Goodliva aims to use this next loan to improve the condition of the stall and to have enough liquidity to ensure a steady supply of fish. 

Goodliva will share this loan with her loan group, Compressor, which totals 10 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Goodliva can be seen wearing red in the front row.

loans.use: To improve the condition of the fish sales stall and to have enough liquidity to ensure a steady supply of fish.

loans.name: Waridi Group

texts.en:
Claus A. is in his early-thirties and is currently single.  He owns his own fruit and vegetable stall and has been operating it for the past 3 months. The stall is open daily between 8 am and 9 pm and earns Claus a low monthly profit. 

This will be Claus' first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania.  He aims to use the loan to improve the food stall as well as making more funds available to buy more vegetables to sell.  Claus' dream is to one day expand his business so that he can open his own store.

Claus will share this loan with his loan group Waridi, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Claus can be seen second from left, wearing a white suit.

loans.use: To improve the food stall as well as making more funds available to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Aparicia

texts.es:
La Sra  Aparicia   es casada tiene   2  hijos,  todos   en edad escolar.
Ella    se dedica a la venta de artículos   electrónicos,  en su domicilio que está ubicado por la Súper Carretera, cuya venta le genera  un buen ingreso.

Con la ayuda de su esposo  y toda la familia están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y dedicación.
La venta de electrónica es muy común en Ciudad del Este y muchas familias se mantienen con este negocio.
Afortunadamente  a la familia de la señora Aparicia le va muy bien con las ventas, y solicita el préstamo para la compra de celulares, radios, mp3 y otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Aparicia is married and has two school age children. She sells electronic devices from her home located along the superhighway. Through her sales she is able to generate a good income. With the help of her husband and the rest of her family, Aparicia is able to move forward with great sacrifice and dedication. Selling electronics is a very common business among many families in Ciudad del Este as a way of supporting themselves.

Fortunately for her family, Sra. Aparacia has done very well with her sales. She is requesting a loan to buy mobile phones, radios, mp3 players, and other devices.

loans.use: Purchase mobile phones, radios, mp3 players, and other devices

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en:
Sahib J. is a 44-year-old trader who sells food products in Sabirabad. He started his business in 2006 and since that time he has been doing well. He sells flour, beverages, candies, macaroni and other stuff. 

Sahib is married and has four children; the eldest son is also helping him in the shop. Income from this shop is the only financial source in Sahib`s family and he is set on increasing it.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise to increase income

loans.name: Grayik

texts.en:
Grayik H. is 45 years old. He lives in Zovaber village, Sevan area with his wife and his three children: two daughters and a son.
 
In 2002 Grayik  rented a small workshop where he has been involved in a tire casing repair service till now. Thanks to his business income, he provides for his family's needs and pays for his children's education. 

At the same time Grayik and his family engage in farming: they have cows, sheep, pigs and chickens and a plot of land. Grayik’s wife and son do the major part of the farm work and so help him to cover their family’s needs.

Grayik is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy some up-to-date tire casing repair tools for his workshop.

loans.use: To buy some up-to-date tire casing repair tools for his workshop

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has no children yet. She has two dependents who live with her because they are her husband’s relatives. In the year 2007, Fatmata established her plastic bowls, buckets, kettles and other utensils business. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,447,000 SLL every month from this business. She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL.

Fatmata has a very good loan repayment history. She now requires a new loan to help her buy more business stock. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 450,000 SLL. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls, buckets, and kettles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ntungamo Kwetungura Group

texts.en:
N. Juliet is 30 years old and the leader of the Ntungamo Kwetungura group.  She is a business woman involved in the sale of bogoya (yellow bananas) from Ntungamo Park Yard for over 12 years and her customers are mostly travelers and residents in and around the park. In a week, she is able to make 80,000 UGX as profits.  

She needs a loan to be able to buy more bogoya for resale.  She usually buys in bunches and she says that it was a friend who introduced her to this business.  Juliet is a social, honest and determined woman who is married with 4 children between the ages of 3 to 14 years old and her dream is to educate her children, buy a plot of land and to be able to diversify her business in the future.

loans.use: Buy more bogoya ( yellow bananas ) for resale.

loans.name: Ehtiram

texts.en: Ehtiram M. is a 49-year-old farmer who sells seasonal fruits and vegetables together with his wife. Ehtiram has three children. He sells the fruits and vegetables in the street of his home city, Sabirabad, and has been doing it for the last three years. He applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizer. He wishes to open his own shop next to his house in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Miraga

texts.en: Miraga S. is a 47-year-old farmer who raise cattle. He has five years of experience in this field. Currently Miraga has three cows. He usually purchases small calves, raises them and sells them in the livestock bazaar once every 6 months. His main income is from selling milk and milk products. He is married with a son and daughter. His son helps Miraga to look after his cows. Miraga applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to buy an additional cow.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow and fodder.

loans.name: Bukono Kwetungura Group A, Kihihi

texts.en:
A. Robina is the leader of her lending group named Bukono Kwetungura A in Kihihi.  She is 28 years old and married with 3 children, with two of them in school.  Robina has a produce sales business and a farm that produces coffee that she sells to the factory in Bukono and other dealers.  She is able to earn 280,000 UGX as monthly profits.  

Robina has been a farmer for a while and since she has a ready market, she does not regret being in her business.  She is a determined woman and very hard working and as a result of taking loans, she has managed to construct a permanent house in Bukono Trading Centre.

loans.use: To buy more coffee to resell at the factory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more ladies' underwear and children's clothes.

loans.name: Casimira

texts.es:
La Señora Casimira A.  se inicio como cliente de la Fundación Paraguaya  el año 2009, está acompañada con el Señor Domingo Castillo, con quien son padres de 5 hijos, están domiciliados  Acaray, posee casa propia.
Están dedicados en forma familiar, a la venta de Ollas de hierro, y artículos varios como ser frazadas, licuadoras, ollas de aluminios entre otros, realizan distribución por toda la zona, llegando hasta la Ciudad de San Alberto.
Poseen un histórico de pago excelente, se tratan de personas trabajadoras y con una visión de superación, agradecen el apoyo que nuestra Institución le está brindando.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de otros aparatos electrónicos.
texts.en:
Sra. Casimira A. started as a client of Fundación Paraguaya in 2009. She is married to Sr. Domingo Castillo and they are the parents of five children. They live in Acaray, where they own a home.

Casimira and her husband have a family business selling iron pots and miscellaneous items such as blankets, blenders, aluminum pans, and other products. They distribute their merchandise throughout the area, as far as the city of San Alberto.

Casimira has an excellent payment history. She is a hardworking person who has the vision to succeed.

Casimira is grateful for the support Fundación Paraguaya has provided. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy other types of electrical appliances.

loans.use: Purchase electrical appliances to sell

loans.name: Obama Group

texts.en:
Mohamed I. is in his early thirties and is married with three children.  He has been running a second hand clothing business since 2006.  The store is open daily between 8:00 am and 8:00 pm and earns Mohamed a low monthly profit.

This will be Mohamed's fifth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania.  Mohamed used his previous loans to increase his stock of clothes.  These loans have now been successfully repaid.  With his fifth loan, Mohamed aims to again increase his stock and help complete a house which he is currently building for himself. 

Mohamed will share this loan with his loan group Obama, which totals 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Mohamed can be seen second from right, front row.

loans.use: Increase stock of used clothes.

loans.name: Alaisha

texts.en:
Alaisha N. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (sisters and brothers). Alaisha lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

Alaisha has a food stall. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days out of every week. Alaisha sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale.  

Alaisha has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of tomatoes, pineapples, onions and Irish potatoes.

The main business challenges for Alaisha include thieves and transportation. Her goal for her business is owning a delivery van.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes, onions, tomatoes and pineapples.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
El Sr.  Demetrio está casado con la señora Dalia que se     dedica a la  confección de ropa,  él se dedica a la peluquería, cuyo negocio está ubicado   en el barrio Boquerón de C.D.E. el trabajo del  mismo es gratificante, ya que cuenta con una considerable cantidad de cliente, y el ingreso es bastante satisfactorio.
Con la ayuda de su esposa  están  saliendo adelante con voluntad, trabajo y dedicación.
Hoy día se ha convertido en una microempresario exitoso y en constante progreso.
Es muy cumplidora con sus compromisos por lo que merece el debido apoyo para seguir creciendo.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de compra de telas  para confecciones que realiza su señora y también aprovecha para comprar algunas herramientas de trabajo que le hacen falta.
texts.en:
Sr. Demetrio is married to Sra. Dalia who makes clothes for a living. He manages a barber shop located in the neighborhood of Boquerón in Ciudad del Este. Demetrio finds his work rewarding since he has a considerable number of customers and generates an income that is quite satisfactory. With the help of his wife he is able to move forward with determination, effort, and dedication. Today he has become a successful entrepreneur who makes constant progress. He is dutiful to his commitments and deserves the appropriate support to keep growing.

Demetrio is requesting a loan to buy fabrics for his wife’s sewing business. He will also take advantage of this opportunity to purchase some equipment that he lacks for his job.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for his barber shop & fabric for his wife's sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy suitcases of different sizes.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
El Sr. Eladio G. tiene 52 años, es casado con la Sra. María tiene 2 hijos mayores que ya no dependen de  ellos ya son profesionales e independientes.
 Su negocio tiene una antigüedad de aproximadamente 8 años,  el comenzó a trabajar en forma independiente gracias a sus ahora que venía juntando de otros trabajos que realizaba anteriormente. 
Es decir, que  el negocio fue montado con  de las ganancias que  obtenía de las ventas de mercaderías, el cual realizaba en forma ambulante. 
Hoy día don Eladio y la Sra. Maria atienden el negocio; que gracias a sus esfuerzos  esta a nivel de la competencia y con un crecimiento sistemático. 
 El Sr. Eladio  tiene casa propia, necesita aumentar sus compras y así consigue descuentos interesantes y en consecuencia logra mayor margen de ganancia en sus ventas. 
 El manifiesta que la única forma de crecimiento es através de los créditos, porque le resulta muy difícil conseguir acumular el capital operativo, razón por el cual opta por este pedido. 
 El es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que vaya a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra
texts.en:
Sr. Eladio G. is 52 years old and married to Sra. María. They have two grown children who are no longer dependent on them since they are professionals and live independently.

His business has been in operation for approximately eight years. Eladio started working independently after gaining experience from his previous jobs. In other words, he was able to start this business using the income he earned selling merchandise as a traveling salesman.

Today Sr. Eladio and Sra. Maria manage the business. Thanks to their efforts, they have kept up with the competition and achieved a systematic level of growth. Sr. Eladio owns a home and needs to make larger purchases in order to get the attractive discounts that will help him increase his profit margin. He says the only way for him to grow is by obtaining loans since it is very difficult to build up operating capital. This is why he is submitting this request.

Eladio is a very responsible person who desires to succeed. He has a youthful and enterprising spirit. There is no doubt that he will accomplish all the goals that he has set forth for himself. He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise.

loans.use: Purchase pasta, herbs, rice, sugar, flour, and other items

loans.name: Nasir

texts.en:
Nasir J. is a 47-year-old farmer who breeds cattle in the small village of Sabirabad since 2004. He is married and has three children. He buys small calves, raises them and sells them in the livestock bazaar or to local butchers. Nasir's son helps him in raising cattle.

Nasir would like to increase the number of cattle and purchase more. This will allow him to increase his income and improve the life of his family. Cattle raising is the only financial source in his family and he promises to repay on time.

loans.use: To purchase two cows and fodder.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a forty-six-year-old married man with five children living in their own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His aspiration is having all his children graduate and work in reputable institutions. He is a poultry farmer and has been in the business for four years.  He has been able to increase the number of chicks almost every month. Patrick intends to use the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: Paying school fees for his children

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty B. lives in the Ntinda neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  Alaisha   has a farming business. She has been in this business for 3 years, and she works 7 days a week. Betty sells her products at the wholesale market.  

Betty has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more millet, mother spawn and mushroom seeds.  She also generates additional income through rental rooms.  The main business challenges for Betty include seasonality and transportation.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start exporting mushrooms to other African countries.  Betty lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication

loans.use: To buy more millet, mushroom and mother spawn seeds.

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu K., a 25-year-old trader who has sold a variety of foodstuffs with his wife in the city of Sabirabad for the last four years, has two children. He would like to expand his business and so is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to increase profit

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a thirty-six-year-old man, married to a teacher with three children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family wish is to educate his children and improve the daily incomes and savings since he has the duty to provide the basics to his dependents. He has a lorry and has been driving it by himself for seven years which gives him a comparative advantage in maximizing his profits. 

He also supplies building materials. His business aspiration is owning a second lorry and supplying large quantities of building materials. Abubakar needs the loan to buy building materials: sand, bricks, and stones  for resale.

loans.use: Buying building materials: sand, bricks, and stones  for resale

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El Señor Emilio F. se inicio con nuestra Institución en el año 2009, está casado con la Señora Vicenta Montania con quien tiene 3 hijos, están domiciliados Ciudad Nueva de Cuidad del Este, posee casa propia.
La pareja se dedica  a la compra al por mayor de mercaderías de primera necesidad como ser harina, azúcar, frutas, verduras etc., y lo distribuye en toda la zona, donde posee una clientela formada, lo realiza con uno de sus hijos mayores, en dos motos de carga que obtuvieron con la ayuda de uno de los créditos que le otorgamos, siempre demostrando moralidad de pago, como lo demuestra su antecedentes.
Son personas honestas y trabajadoras y con un espíritu de emprendedurismo, en esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su distribución.
texts.en:
Sr. Emilio F. started with Fundación Paraguaya in 2009. He is married to Sra. Vicenta Montania and they have three children. They live in Ciudad Nueva in Ciudad del Este, where they own a home.

Emilio buys basic necessities in bulk such as flour, sugar, fruit, vegetables, and other products and distributes them throughout the area. He has an established customer base and conducts his work with the help of one of his grown children. They have two motorcycles that were obtained using one of the loans Emilio obtained. He has always been honest with his payments, as demonstrated through his previous loans.

Emilio is a truthful and hardworking person who possesses the spirit of entrepreneurship. He has taken this opportunity to request a loan for buying merchandise for distribution.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise in bulk for distribution

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a fifty-year-old ambitious man, married with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His desire is to increase the daily household income and savings. For fifteen years, Ahmed has been in carpentry work and the business has helped him to pay school fees for his children although he still has a challenge of limited capital to purchase his raw materials. His wish is to have a fully fledged workshop dealing in all kinds of furniture.

Ahmed needs the loan to purchase lumber for carpentry work.

loans.use: Purchasing lumber for carpentry work.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N., who is married and has three children, all of whom are in school, lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. Harriet has had a business selling cereals wholesale at the market for the past four years, and she works seven days a week. Her main business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of beans. Her business goal is to start exporting beans to Tanzania.

Harriet owns the home she lives in and has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni N. lives in the Busega neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 8 children, all of whom are in school. Zaituni has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days a week. She sells her product from home. Zaituni lives in a home that she owns. She doesn't have access to electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.


Zaituni has requested for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Zaituni include the rainy season and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand to the village of Luwero for charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Ana Francisca; ella tiene 25 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de préstamo de dinero a sus amigos , vecinos, y familiares ,a la vez  ella realiza prótesis dentales lo cual también lo vende a los consultorios dentales.
 
La  socia solicita el préstamo para elaborar las prótesis dentales que tiene pendiente para entregar a los consultorios dentales ,ella comprara los materiales.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Vamos Juntos” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco. 

The member is Ana Francisca. She is 25 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child. She alternates her daily activities with a business lending money to her friends, neighbors, and family members. She also makes dental prosthetics and sells them to dental offices.

She is requesting the loan to make the dental prosthetics that she already has orders for so that she can get them to the dentists’ offices. She will buy the materials she needs.

She is grateful to those who are helping her with her dream through this program and she promises to make her payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: To make dental prosthetics that she has orders for so that she can get them to the requesting dentists’ offices; she will buy the materials she needs.

loans.name: Katerero Twimukye Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
T. Peace is the leader of her lending group in Ntungamo.  She is 33 years old and married with 4 children and all of them are attending school while she takes care of other dependants.  

Peace is involved in the sale of bananas some of which she grows herself and she is usually helped by casual labourers in the transaction of her business. She has been operating the business for at least 12 years from Omwinoni village and she is able to make 30,000 UGX as weekly profits.  

Since Peace wants to make more profits, she needs a loan to be able to buy Irish potatoes to make a local brew for business expansion and diversion. She is a social and cooperative woman and her dream is to be able to push her children to higher levels of education for sustainability.  Ever since Peace started taking loans, she has realized growth and prosperity and she is happy about such an achievement. Peace belongs to the Katerero Twimukye group.

loans.use: To purchase Irish potatoes to make brew.

loans.name: Las Naranjas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama  "Las Naranjas" y se integra D. seis señoras cada una con diferente actividad, le dieron como nombre "Las Naranjas"  ya que cuando se realizó L. firma D. contrato era  tiempo D. cosecha D. naranjas y mandarinas.
     
 L. señora quien se le entrevisto es nueva integrante y se llama Hilda R. López, es madre soltera con un pequeño D. siete años D. nombre Herbin Mauricio él está estudiando el segundo año D. primaria.
    
 ElL. solicitó el préstamo para  surtir su mini tienda D. abarrotes, ya que le hacían falta algunas cosas que no podía comprar por falta D. ingresos, hoy espera que con este apoyo logre surtirlo y salga adelante.
     
Lo que L. motivó a realizar ésta actividad fue su pequeño hijo, pues elL. necesitaba un negocio para darle lo mejor y deseaba también estar al pendiente D. él, y lo única forma D. hacerlo era tener su propio negocio. 
     
Con las ganancias que ha logrado obtener lo invierte comprando lo más necesario para su negocio, así el negocio se ve más surtido y su clienteL. le compre con gusto.
      
Lo más importante para elL. es que su negocio crezca para poder ahorrar y sacar adelante a su hijo dándole una buena educación y sea una persona con futuro.
     
 Formo parte del grupo por una invitación que le hizo su vecina doña Vitalina, a integrarse al grupo y así tenga un dinero D. donD. pueda disponer y surtir su negocio
      
   Las personas que integran el grupo son:

Rosalinda Hernández López: invierte el préstamo en L. compra D. ropas para luego venderlo en las comunidades cercanas D. su localidad.
María Vitalina Sánchez D. L. C.: invertirá el préstamo en L. compra D. productos por catalogo  y venderlo en L. comunidad.
Silvina A. R.: invertirá en L. compra D. hoja D. guineo y venderlo en L. misma comunidad y también en L. ciudad D. TuxtL. Gutiérrez.
Teresa Juárez Vázquez: comprara ropas en L. mesilL.  y luego venderlo en L.  misma región.
CarmeL. González Mejía: invertirá el crédito en L. compra D. útiles escolares, para surtir su papelería.
Hilda R. López: invertirá el préstamo en L. compra D. mercancía para surtir su tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
This group, called "Las Naranjas" [The Oranges] is maD. up of six women, each with a different type of work. They chose the name "Las Naranjas"  because they signed the contract to form as a group during the orange harvest. 
     
The group member profiled here is a new member named Hilda R. López. She is a single mother with a seven-year-old son named Herbin Mauricio, who is currently in second graD..
    
Hilda is asking for a loan to stock her small grocery store, as there are a few items that she needs to restock but cannot buy at the moment due to a lack of capital. She hopes that this loan will allow her to restock the store and move forward with this venture. 
     
Her motivation in opening the store was her young son. She needed a job that would let her proviD. for him as best she could, but also one that would let her stay near him and take care of him. The only way to do both was to start this small business. 
     
She has been investing her earnings in buying more items to sell at her store, so that she can offer a wider variety of goods and keep her customers satisfied. Her main goal is to see her business grow so that she can begin saving money to help her son get ahead, by giving him a good education and a bright future.
      
Hilda became part of the "Las Naranjas" group through an invitation from her neighbor Vitalina, who encouraged her to join in order to be able to get the funds to fully stock her store.
      
The members of the "Las Naranjas" group are:

Rosalinda Hernández López: She will use her loan to buy clothing, which she sells in nearby communities.
María Vitalina Sánchez D. L. C.: She will use her loan to buy catalog products to sell locally.
Silvina A. R.: She will use her loan to buy banana leaves to sell in her community and in TuxtL. Gutiérrez.
Teresa Juárez Vázquez: She will use her loan to buy clothes in L. MesilL. and sell them in nearby areas. 
CarmeL. González Mejía: She will use her loan to buy school supplies, to stock her paper goods store.
Hilda R. López: She will use her loan to buy merchandise to stock her small grocery store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her small grocery store.

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: Lola tiene 50 años, vive en su casa que es propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 10 años, Lola se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, es así que viene  recorriendo las calles de su distrito, ofreciendo estos productos por medio de catálogos a sus amigas y vecinas de su barrio, quienes la conocen. Es así que pasada del medio día empieza con las cobranzas de sus clientes, por lo que tiene que caminar de casa en casa, además aprovecha para realizar algún otro pedido.  Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es que tiene clientes muy responsables en sus pagos, esto hace que su negocio sea muy rentable, por lo que trabaja con mucho motivación, tratando de vender mucho más cada día. Con el tiempo, desea tener un negocio de venta de anticuchos, de esa manera se generaría más ganancias. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete  pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente,  ya que le gustaría acceder a otras ayudas. De su banco comunal tiene buenas referencias y espera integrarse al grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más productos de belleza, para abastecer todos los pedidos por entregar.
texts.en:
Lola is 50 years old. She lives in her own house, along with her husband and 3 children. For the past 10 years, Lola has been selling beauty products. She offers these products through catalogs to her friends and neighbors who know her. 

A little after noon everyday, she begins collecting payments from her customers; to do this, she goes door to door. She also uses this time to get more orders. What she likes most about her business is that she has customers who are very responsible with their payments. This makes her business very profitable, so she is very motivated and tries to sell as much as possible every day. Eventually, she hopes to have a business selling antichuchos [shish kebabs of beef heart], so that she can increase her income. 

This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she promises to make her payments punctually, as she would like to have other loans. She has good references from her communal bank and she hopes to join the group. With the loan, she will buy more beauty products so that she can fill all of the orders she has.

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Amani Hondogo Group

texts.en:
Hamisi O. is in his early thirties and is married with one child.  Since 2002, Hamisi has been running an auto repair shop from which he sells spare parts for motorbikes.  The shop is open between 7:00 am and 5:00 pm and earns Hamisi a good monthly profit.

This will be Hamisi's first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania.  Hamisi aims to use this loan to increase his stock in key spare parts.  He also aims to expand his business by introducing several parts which he has not had earlier.  Hamisi's dream is to see his business grow steadily so that he can support his daughter. 

Hamisi will share this loan with his loan group Amani Hondogo, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. 

In the picture, Hamisi can be seen wearing green in the back row.

loans.use: To increase his stock in key spare parts for motorbikes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ntamugabumwe Group

texts.fr: M. Theophile est commerçant, et il est un membre du groupe Ntamugabumwe.  Il est marié, et il a deux  enfants entre 6mois et 3ans, aussi il a 28 ans.  Avec son prêt, il veut acheter les maniocs pour les détailler au marché de sake.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargne sur son compte.  Il voudrait avoir la capacité d’autofinancement.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait satisfaire leur besoins.
texts.en:
Theophile M. is a 28-year-old merchant and member of the Ntamugabumwe solidarity group. He is married and has two children, a 3-year-old and a 6-month-old. 

With his loan, he wants to buy cassava for resale at the Sake market. His strategy for business growth is to boost his savings, as he would like to be able to self-finance. He also wants to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy cassava

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Adelaida; ella tiene 25 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; la socia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como shampus,cremas,perfumes de varon y mujer entre otros luego lo distribuye a sus smigos, ella trabaja para la linea avon.
 
La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mas productos para su negocio y asi tener mas variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
[Adelaida] is a member of the “Vamos Juntos” (Let’s Go Together) communal bank, located in the Cusco district, within the Cusco department and province.

Adelaida is 25 years old.  She is in a cohabitating relationship, has one son, and sells Avon brand beauty products, such as shampoo, creams, men’s and women’s cologne, among other items.  She then distributes them to her friends.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy additional products so that she can offer a greater variety to her customers.

Our associate appreciates those persons who help make this dream possible through this means and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 29 años, vive en casa de sus suegros, junto a su esposo y su hija. La actividad a la que se dedica Luz, es el servicio de cortes, peinados, tintes y demás tratamientos de belleza. Su local se encuentra ubicado al frente de su casa, es un local alquilado. Desde entonces atiende con mucha amabilidad a sus clientes, se siente muy feliz por su trabajo además que se desenvuelve muy bien en lo que hace, parte de su desarrollo se debe al apoyo que le dio su esposo para instalar este salón de belleza, ya que anteriormente trabajaba asistente, siendo 14 horas continuas de esfuerzo y experiencia, hoy tiene su propio negocio. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio y acondicionar un spa, de ese modo tener el reconocimientos y elección de sus clientes. Es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que este dinero le será muy beneficioso para equipar su salón de belleza. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de líquidos, tintes y cremas faciales, de ese modo poder brindar un servicio apropiado a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz, who is 29 years old, lives in her mother- and father-in-law’s house, along with her husband and their daughter. 

Luz has a hairstyling business, doing hair cuts, hair styling, coloring, and other beauty treatments. Her store is located in front of her house, and she rents the space. She always treats her customers in a very friendly manner. She is very happy with her job and she does it well. Part of her success owes to the support her husband gave her when she opened the beauty salon. She used to work as an assistant, working 14 hour days of hard work and gaining experience; now she has her own business. Her greatest wish is to expand her business to include a spa so that she can have more recognition and more clients. 

This is her first loan with Microfinzas Prisma, and she promises to make her payments punctually since this money will be very beneficial for equiping her beauty salon. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy liquids, hair dyes, and facial creams so that she can provide better service to her clients.

loans.use: To buy hair dyes and face creams for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Mwale Group

texts.en:
Husna S. is in her mid 20s and has a five-year-old daughter. Husna has been running a tabletop fruits and vegetables business since 2008. The shop is open between 5:00 am and 5:00 pm daily and earns Husna a low monthly profit. 

This will be Husna's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Husna used her first loan to increase her business and to start supplying other people with fruits and vegetables. Husna has since successfully repaid that loan. With her second loan, Husna aims to open a salon in Tabata. Her dream is to  open a clothing shop.

Husna will share this loan with her loan group Mwale, which has 16 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. 

In the picture, Husna can be seen wearing a yellow shirt in the first row.

loans.use: To open a salon

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Presentación; ella tiene 55 años de edad, casada  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de picantería (ella prepara platos típicos a base de leña y carbón) siendo su horario desde las 08:00am hasta las 07:00pm, la socia trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo ambos sacan a su familia adelante mediante su negocio.

La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para su negocio como carbón,leña,arroz,aceite entre otros. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
[Presentación] is a member of the “Vamos Juntos” (Let’s Go Together) communal bank, located in the Cusco district, within the Cusco department and province.

Adelaida is 55 years old.  She is married, has four children and sells food (typical dishes cooked under firewood and charcoal) from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM.  She works alongside her husband and, together, they are moving their family ahead through this business.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies and ingredients, such as charcoal, firewood, rice, and cooking oil, among other things.

Our associate appreciates those persons who help make this dream possible through this means and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Supples and ingredients

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Sebastiana; ella tiene 34 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia tiene su taller de pintura en su casa, ella pinta y después lo vende a sus amigos,familiares ,vecinos y a las personas que le solicitan, a la vez la socia lleva sus pinturas fuera de cusco a sus demás clientes. 

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para que siga realizando su arte que es la pintura.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
[Sebastiana] is a member of the “Vamos Juntos” (Let’s Go Together) communal bank, located in the Cusco district, within the Cusco department and province.

Sebastiana is 34 years old.  She is in a cohabitating relationship, has two children, and has an art studio (painting) in her home.  She creates paintings and then sells them to her family, friends, neighbors, and other people who request them.  She also takes her paintings to her customers outside of Cusco.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies so that she can continue painting.

Our associate appreciates those persons who help make this dream possible through this means and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Makoka Group

texts.en: Peragia M. is in her early thirties and is married with two children. Peragia opened her own charcoal and water business six months ago. The business is open between 6:00 a.m. and 9:00 p.m. and earns Peragia a low monthly profit. This will be Peragia's first motisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. A motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Peragia aims to use this loan to buy a new water tank where she will store her water. Peragia will share this loan with her loan group Makoko, which totals 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans. In the picture, Peragia can be seen wearing white, first on the right by the tree.

loans.use: To buy another water tank

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 35 años, es una madre muy amorosa, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijas. Desde hace 3 años, Martha se dedica a la venta de ropa, ya que desde niña fue su mayor anhelo. Gracias a su buen carácter para la venta, le ha dado ventaja para desenvolverse bien en este trabajo, asimismo tiene que renovar constantemente los modelos o diseños de acuerdo a la moda, para que sus clientes no dejen de comprarle. Este trabajo le es muy rentable, con las ganancias puede ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que esta al pendiente de la moda, sin embargo debe poner todo su esfuerzo para vender su mercadería, tener que recorrer las calles y llegar hacia sus clientes. Con el tiempo, desea poner un bazar de ropa, donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad sus prendas casuales. Es su 11avo crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para su negocio, es por ello que se compromete en pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en el incremento de más prendas de vestir, para abastecerse de las novedades de la temporada.
texts.en:
Martha is 35 years old and a loving mother who lives in her own home, along with her husband and two daughters.  For the past three years, Martha has been selling clothing, which had been her greatest desire since childhood.  Thanks to her knack at sales, she's been able to develop this profession very well and constantly needs to update her inventory to keep up with the latest trends, so that her customers will continue to buy from her.

This job is very profitable and her earnings allow her to help her husband with the household expenses.  What she enjoys most is that she is tuned in to the latest trends, but she never the less has to put all of her efforts into selling her merchandise, having to travel the streets to reach her customers.  Eventually, she wants to open a small clothing store, where she'll be able to sell her casual clothing comfortably. 

This will be her 11th loan through MFP and knows that this support will be very beneficial to her business, so she is committed to making her payments on time.  She will use the money from this loan to invest in more clothing items in order to be able to stock the latest items for the season.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Javy´aha Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité inició la señora Ana Cristina G. de Monday _Minga Guazú. 
Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona.
El comité se denomina Javy`aha están en el Octavo Ciclo con 11  integrantes. 
Cada una de las integrantes tiene su actividad y lo realiza con el fin de generar un ingreso para sus familias, ya que todas las integrantes del comité son madres de familia.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Alma, quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Ella compra los perfumes y ofrece a sus clientes al contado y a crédito, y actualmente cuenta con varios clientes.
Comenta que es difícil colocar los productos, pero que compensa con las buenas ganancias que deja y además porque ella puede organizar su tiempo si descuidar a su familia.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de más perfumes sugeridos por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana Cristina G. de Monday -Minga Guazú began forming this group.  She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the group within her zone.  The group is called "Javy" and is made up of 11 members.  It's is in its 8th cycle.  Each of its members has her own business and they run them with the aim of generating an income for their families, because all the members are mothers.

One of the women, Alma, sells perfumes.  She buys them and offers them to her customers for cash and credit.  She has various regular customers.

She tells us that it's difficult to set up the products, but her reward is a good income and it also allows her to manage her time without neglecting her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy more perfumes suggested by her customers.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Vilma Flora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra.Vilma; ella tiene 39 años de edad, casada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de venta de yogurth ,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria especialmente en las ferias de los días sabados en la plaza Tupac Amaru de Cusco y a la vez vende a sus vecinas , amigos y familiares.

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de de insumos para su negocio comoleche,azúcar y algunas frutas como platano,fresa,manzana entre otros.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
[Vilma] is a member of the “Vamos Juntos” (Let’s Go Together) communal bank, located in the Cusco district, within the Cusco department and province.

Sebastiana is 39 years old.  She is married, has three children, and has a yogurt business.  She sells on foot, especially at the weekend (Saturday) fairs, held in the Tupac Amaru plaza in Cusco.  She also sells to her family, friends, and neighbors.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy ingredients, such as milk, sugar, and some fruits like bananas, strawberries, apples, and other things.

Our associate appreciates those persons who help make this dream possible through this means and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar es una joven soltera de 26 años, vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de sus 3 hermanos menores. Pilar trabaja en sociedad con su padre, instalando alarmas y  cercos eléctricos a pequeñas empresas  privadas  e instituciones publicas. Su padre es quien hace todo el trabajo de las instalaciones eléctricas y Pilar es la encargada de buscar nuevos clientes. De esta manera trabajan hace mas de 3 años en esta actividad, que le genera buenas utilidades. Lo que más le gusta de su labor, es que conoce muchos empresarios,  quienes le contactan con otras empresas y así aumenta su cartera de clientes. En adelante, anhela  ampliar su negocio y en un futuro no muy lejano prestar servicios a provincias. Es su 11avo crédito con MFP,  y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual. En su grupo comunal, es un cliente muy activo preocupado por el bienestar de su grupo. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará 200 metros de cables para instalación eléctrica.
texts.en:
Pilar is a single 26 year old young lady who lives at home with her parents and three younger brothers.  Pilar works with her father, installing alarm systems and electric fences for small private companies and public buildings.  Her father does all the installation work and Pilar is in charge of finding new customers.  They've been working this way for the past three years and the business generates good profits.  What she enjoys most about her work is that it allows her to meet many entrepreneurs, who put her in touch with other companies, allowing her to build her customer base.  In the future she wants to expand her business and in the near future, wants to provide provincial services.

This will be her 11th loan through MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time.  She is very active in her communal bank and always shows concern about the group's well being.  She will use the money from this loan to buy 200 meters of electrical cable.

loans.use: Electrical cable

loans.name: Arlene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra.Arlene; ella tiene 28 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de artesanía ella vende CDS y DVS  de la historia de Cusco,Valle Sagrado,Machupicchu entre otros ,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria todas las mañanas y todas las tardes por las calles de Cusco.

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería  y así poder ofrecer á mas clientes y dar a conocer un poco mas de nuestra historia mediante su negocio.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo
texts.en:
[Arlene] is a member of the “Vamos Juntos” (Let’s Go Together) communal bank, located in the Cusco district, within the Cusco department and province.

Arlene is 28 years old.  She is in a cohabitating relationship, has two children, and sells CDs and DVDs that tell the history of Cusco,Valle Sagrado,Machupicchu, and other places.  She sells on foot, in the streets of Cusco, every morning and evening.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy more merchandise so that she can sell to more customers and let more people learn our history through this business.

Our associate appreciates those persons who help make this dream possible through this means and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Karen Rossmary

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra.Karen; ella tiene 39 años de edad, casada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de venta de yogurt (lácteos) la socia lo distribuye a sus amigos y personas que le soliciten ,también vende en las ferias de los días sábados en la  plaza Tupac Amaru  yogurt diferentes sabores como fresa,manzana,mango entre otros.

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como azúcar ,leche, frutas (platano,manazana,mango). 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
[Karen] is a member of the “Vamos Juntos” (Let’s Go Together) communal bank, located in the Cusco district, within the Cusco department and province.

Karen is 39 years old.  She is married, has three children, and sells yogurt (milk products) to her friends and other people who request her products.  She also sells different flavors of yogurt, like strawberry, apple, mango, among others, at the Saturday fairs held at the Tupac Amaru plaza.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy ingredients such as sugar, milk, and fruits (bananas, apples, mangos).

Our associate appreciates those persons who help make this dream possible through this means and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Maria Yenny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra.Maria; ella tiene 37 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se  dedica a la artesanía haciendo aretes, collares,pulseras para luego distribuirlo a las tiendas que tienen este tipo de negocio.La socia es una persona muy emprendedora y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería para su negocio  y así poder ofrecer á mas clientes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the “Vamos Juntos” (Let’s Go Together) communal bank, located in the Cusco district, within the Cusco department and province.

Karen is 37 years old.  She is married, has three children, and is an artist who makes necklaces, and bracelets, to sell in shops.  She is a very entrepreneurial woman and moves her family ahead in this manner. 

She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies so that she can sell to more customers.

Our associate appreciates those persons who help make this dream possible through this means and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Wilson Oswaldo

texts.es:
Wilson de 58 años, tiene un puesto de venta de ceviche de concha (hecha con limón, sal, concha, cebolla) un plato marinero muy típico en la playa. Vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Hace 20 años atrás comenzó con el negocio de venta de ceviche de concha para mantener a sus hijos. El trabajo lo realiza con ayuda de sus hijos ya que ellos recorren las playas vendiéndole a los turistas los ceviches de concha mientras que el también trabaja en un puesto de madera vendiendo los ceviches. Trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 19h00pm vendiendo cada plato de 12 conchas a $ 4.00. 

Para seguir con su negocio él quiere comprar con el préstamo mas conchas a los pescadores para tener más ingresos. En el futuro quiere tener su negocio en otro lugar mas cómodo para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Wilson, 58 years old, has a food stall where he sells shellfish ceviche (made with lemon, salt, shellfish and onion), a very typical seafood dish, on the beach.  He lives in an area called Playas, one of the tourist attractions in Ecuador, where there is a diverse range of shellfish.  

He began his business selling shellfish ceviche 20 years ago to provide for his children.  His children help him work, walking up and down the beach selling shellfish ceviche to the tourists, while he works in a wooden food stall selling the ceviches.  He works from 7:30am until 7:00pm, selling each plate of 12 shellfish for $4.00. 

To continue with his business, he would like to use the loan to buy more shellfish from the fishermen so he can earn more money.  In the future he would like to have his business in another location more comfortable for his clients.

loans.use: Shellfish

loans.name: Brenda Group

texts.es:
El grupo de Brenda está compuesto por Brenda Irene B., Esther Martínez Mendoza y Martha Esperanza M., tres féminas quienes desean salir adelante. B., coordinadora del grupo se dedica al comercio de  ropa y zapatos por 20 años. En este tiempo ella ha mejorado su negocio y ha logrado salir adelante.
Los otros miembros son Esther, que es un novato en el campo del comercio, ha trabajado en la venta de ropa usada por un año, y Marta ha vendido cosméticos y ropa usada durante 10 años. Con el préstamo que están buscando a los miembros a invertir más en los materiales y productos para mejorar sus negocios y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Brenda's Group consists of Brenda Irene B., Esther Martínez Mendoza and Martha Esperanza M., three women who want to get ahead. B., the group's coordinator has had a clothes and shoes business for 20 years. In this time she has improved her business and has succeeded in getting ahead.
The other members are Esther, who is new to the world of commerce, and has worked in used clothes sales for one year, and Marta who has sold cosmetics and used clothes for 10 years. With the loan that the members are asking for they will buy more materials and products to improve their businesses and get ahead.

loans.use: To stock up on clothes and shoes

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 30 años, es una  madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 1 años y 2 meses, se dedica a la preparación de anticuchos, parrillas y polladas; vendiéndolos solos los fines de semana. Su punto de venta, es el patio de la casa de su madre, donde hace muchos años funciona como establecimiento de venta de comida, cuya dueña es su mamá. Ahora  ha decidido  trabajar en sociedad con su madre, invirtiendo su propio capital. La afluencia de clientes ha aumentado por lo que sola no se puede abastecer, por lo que pronto tendrá que contratar ayudantes. Le gusta su negocio, por lo que es muy rentable, por lo pronto desea ampliar su negocio y comprar sus utensilios y parrillas para implementar su establecimiento. Es su 11avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar tosas sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará  carnes rojas y pollos al por mayor, para seguir trabajando con su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia is 30 years old and is a hard working mother.  She, her husband, and two children live together in her parents’ home.  For the past year and two months, she’s been making and selling grilled chicken and beef kabobs on the weekends, from her mother’s patio.  For many years the patio has served as a point of sale for food.

She has decided to work with her mother and has invested her own money.  The number of customers has increased and she is no longer able to keep up, so she will need to hire helpers.  She likes her business; it is very profitable and she wants to expand it and buy more utensils and grills for the business.

This will be her 11th loan through MFP and she is committed to making all of her payments on time.  She will use the money from this loan to buy red meat and chicken in quantity, so that she can continue working her business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Marcelo Calixto

texts.es:
Marcelo de 45 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive con su esposa (aparece en la foto) e hijos  en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Hace tres años comenzó con la tienda para poder mantener a su esposa y dos hijos. El inicio con una inversión de víveres de $ 60.00 poco a poco la gente le comenzó a comprar los víveres y pudo ubicar su tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. En la actualidad su esposa trabaja en la tienda desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm mientras que el sale a recorrer las calles con una tricimoto y así ganar más dinero hasta que en la noche el se encarga de la tienda para que su esposa atienda a sus hijos. Vende arroz, azúcar, aceite etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar azúcar, aceite, arroz para surtir mas la tienda. En el futuro quiere tener más grande su tienda y poder construir su tienda de cemento ya que es de ladrillo y caña.
texts.en:
Marcelo is 45 years old and has a small store in the front area of his home.  He lives with his wife (shown in the photograph) and children in a hamlet called “Playas.”  It is one of Ecuador’s tourist areas and features a large variety of seafood.

He began the store three years ago so that he would be able to support his wife and two children.  He started with an investment of $60 and little by little people began buying from him, so he was able to locate the store in front of his home.

His wife works in the store, from 7:00 Am to 9:00 PM, while he patrols the streets on a three-wheeled motorcycle, earning more money, and in the evening he works in the store so that his wife can care for the children.   He sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

He will use the money from this loan to buy sugar, cooking oil, and rice for the store.  In the future he wants to better supply his store and expand it, and later build it out of concrete.  It is currently made of brick and thatch.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Cinforosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cinforosa; tiene 59 años de edad, y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella prepara todo tipo de comida para almuerzos y cenas, ella atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de comida. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar  como carne, pollo y verduras.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the “Los Diamantes” (The Diamonds) communal bank, located in the Cusco district, within the Cusco department and province.

Cinforosa is 59 years old.  She is married, has three children, and sells food.  She prepares typical dishes for lunch and dinner and serves customers from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM.  She wants to expand her business and is asking for this loan so that she can buy ingredients, such as meat, chicken, and vegetables.  

Our associate appreciates those persons who help make this dream possible through this means and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 37 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Después de haber trabajado por muchos años,  como ayudante en la venta de gas, aprendió todos los movimientos de este negocio y cuando el dueño le propuso traspasarle el negocio no lo dudo. Es así que hace 1 año, viene dedicándose a la venta de gas,  que se sitúa al  costado de su casa, de esa manera puede brindar un servicio oportuno a sus clientes. Trabaja con la ayuda de un joven, quien con su moto lineal reparte los balones  de gas a los domicilios, por medio de pedido vía telefónica. Esta muy contenta con su negocio; ya que le va muy bien, y lo que más le gusta es que gana muchas amistades que la prefieren a pesar de la ardua competencia del mercado. Con el tiempo, desea ampliar  su negocio, para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Es su 11avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete a seguir pagando puntualmente como hasta ahora. En su grupo comunal, es una socia muy respetada por la puntualidad  de sus cuotas. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará más balones de gas, ya que generalmente trabaja con créditos, para seguir abasteciendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Victoria is 37 years old and is a hard working mother who lives in her own home, along with her husband and four children.  After many years of working as a natural gas sales assistant, she learned all of the ins and outs of the business, so when the business owner proposed transferring it to her, she had no doubt about it.

For the past year, she’s been selling natural gas from a location alongside her home, so she is able to offer opportune service to her customers.  She also has a helper, who uses his motorcycle to deliver cylinders to the homes of customers who have phoned in their orders.

She is happy about her business because it’s going well for her.  What she enjoys most is that she is able to make many friends who prefer to use her services, despite the fierce competition in the market.  She eventually wants to expand her business so that she can better her children’s quality of life.

This will be her 11th loan through MFP and she is committed to continue making her payments on time.  Because of her punctuality, she is much respected within her communal bank.  She will use the money from this loan to buy more compressed gas cylinders – she usually works with loans – in order to supply her customers.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Oriflame Group

texts.es:
El grupo Oriflame  lo conforman  tres féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras quienes trabajan con Adim por su desempeño y labor y las ha beneficiado tanto de las ofertas de préstamos y el desarrollo de la autoestima a través de los programas de formación. 
La señora  Ghisela M. Hernández de 28 años es una mujer trabajadora que ha sido un asistente dental y de la confección y el vendedor de cosméticos durante 2 años y medio. Hernández es madre de dos niños pequeños de 10 y 4 años de edad para los que trabaja muy duro. Ella va a invertir el préstamo en mercadería de ropas aprovechando la temporada

Los otros miembros del grupo son Rosa María B., el vendedor de los productos Oriflame, y Yessenia Zeledón Guerrero, quien tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Ella quiere seguir trabajando y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group Oriflame is made up of 3 working women, hard-working and entrepreneurial, who work with Adim. Adim has benefitted them enormously with the offer of loans and the development of their self-esteem through the formation programs.

Señora Ghisela M. Hernández is 28 years old. She is a hard-working woman who has been a dental and sewing assistant and cosmetic saleswomen for 2.5 years. Hernández is the mother of 2 small children, 10 and 4, for whom she works very hard. She is going to invest this loan in the purchase of clothing - merchandise - to take advantage of the season.

The other members of the group are Rosa María B., who sells Oriflame products, and Yessenia Zeledón Guerrero, who has a small grocery store. She wants to continue working and improve her circumstances.

loans.use: Threads and cosmetics

loans.name: Yovanna

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Yovanna; tiene 38 años de edad, y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella tiene una joyería como collares, pulseras y aretes, la socia atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Los Diamantes" (the diamonds). The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the Cusco Province in Cusco Department.

This member is called Yovanna, she is 38 years old, single and has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling handicrafts. She sells jewellery such as necklaces, bracelets and earrings, attending to her shop from 8am until 8pm. Yovanna wants to expand her business and is seeking a loan to purchase larger quantities of jewellery. 

La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

Yovanna is thankful for the loan she has sought and promises to meet the repayment installments within the established timeframe.

loans.use: Purchase handicrafts

loans.name: Pedro Toribio

texts.es:
Pedro de 45 años, vende cangrejos en un mercado. Vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos de 12, 10, 9, 8 años  en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Comenzó con las ventas de cangrejos como vendedor ambulante frente a un Banco con dos sacos de cangrejos, después de un tiempo le dieron la oportunidad de tener un puesto fijo donde se comercializa mucho mariscos desde ese tiempo ya tiene 13 años en el puesto vendiendo cangrejos a los compradores. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. Diariamente comprar 25 a 30 planchas de cangrejos  (en cada plancha viene 24 cangrejos) para venderlos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cangrejos para tener mayores ingresos. En el futuro quiere tener más clientela y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Pedro is 45 years old and sells crabs in a market. He lives with his wife and 4 children - 12, 10, 9 and 8 years old in a district called Playas, one of the tourist spots in Ecuador with a diversity of seafood.

He began selling crabs door to door outside a bank with 2 sacks of crabs. After a time he was given the opportunity to have a fixed stall where he sold a lot of seafood. Pedro has had this stand for 13 years, selling crabs to the buyers. He works from 7am until 7pm every day. He purchases 25 to 30 sacks of crabs each day (there are 24 crabs in each bag) to sell.

With this loan Pedro wants to purchase crabs to generate better earnings. In the future he wants to have more customers and wants his children to finish studying with success.

loans.use: Purchase crabs

loans.name: Francisca Del Socorro

texts.es:
Francisca del Socorro M. Salazar es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 56 años tiene un comedor donde oferta desayunos, almuerzos y cena en el plantel los coco.  Ella trabaja junto a su compañero de vida con el propósito de ampliar su negocio y salir adelante.
Ella ha participado en las capaciones que Adim brinda lo cual les ha ayudado a salir a delante.
texts.en: Francisca del Socorro M. Salazar is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman of 56. She has a cafeteria where she offers breakfast, lunch and dinner for staff. She works together with her life's companion with the purpose of increasing her business and improve her circumstances. Francisca has participated in the classes that Adim offers, which have helped her to move forward.

loans.use: Purchas rice beansm meat, oil, chicken et

loans.name: Yannina

texts.es: Yannina tiene 20 años, vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de su hijo. Hace 10 años, ayudaba a su madre en la venta de alimentos como: tubérculos, limón, cebolla, ajos, tomate, entre otros. Con el tiempo ha logrado tener la experiencia y eso le animó abrir su propio negocio. Ahora se levanta muy temprano para abastecer su puesto de venta, comprando los productos necesarios como tubérculos y verduras frescas. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en las periferias del mercado mayorista de su distrito. Es así, que con el pasar del tiempo viene forjándose un capital, para poder invertir en su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es que vende muy bien por la afluencia de gente que hay. Con el tiempo, anhela tener su propio puesto de tubérculos en el mercado, para mejorar sus ganancias y poder brindarle una calidad de vida de su familia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otros créditos con mayor facilidad. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en el incremento de tubérculos y verduras, para tener implementar su negocio.
texts.en: Yannina is 20 and lives at home with her parents in the company of her son. For the last 10 years she has helped her mother selling food such as tubers, limes, onion, tomato, among others. With time she has gained experience and this has inspired her to open her own business. Now Yannina gets up very early to stock her stand, purchasing the necessary products such as tubers and fresh vegetables. Her business is located on the periphery of the main market in her district. With the passing of time she has worked had to forge capital to be able to invest in her business. What Yannina likes best about her business is that she sells very well because of the affluence in the area. With time she yearns to have her own stand selling tubers in the market, to improve her earnings and grant good quality of life to her family. This is her first loan with MFP and she knows that if she pays on time she can access other loans more easily. With the loan she is seeking she will invest in purchasing tubers and vegetables to implement in her business.

loans.use: Puchase tubers and vegetables to include in the sales stand.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a twenty-five-year-old hard-working man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is seeing his siblings study and graduate. He owns a fuel pump business and has been in this kind of work for one year. 

Moses has seen tremendous development of his business; he started by selling fuel in jerrycans and later bought a fuel pump which is safer, however, he has a challenge of fuel price fluctuations which makes him experience losses sometimes. His business dream is to own  a petrol station some day. 

Moses needs the loan to buy more fuel for sale.

loans.use: Buying fuel for sale at his pump

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 49 años, es una madre de familia emprendedora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Después de realizar sus labores domesticas Sonia se dedica a la venta de sus productos de belleza, siendo estos productos ofrecidos a sus amigas y vecinas de su barrio, desde entonces, todas las tardes visita a sus clientes a ofrecer la mercadería que tiene, asimismo el pedido lo hacen por medio de catalogo. Siente que su trabajo es muy rentable, sobre todo en las campañas que realiza la empresa, ya que de pasar el monto de sus pedidos, es beneficiada con más productos de manera gratuita; de esa manera le permita tener ingresos adicionales.  Por ello, esta al pendiente de sus clientes, brindándoles una orientación apropiada de los productos que va utilizar. Con el tiempo, desea comprarse vitrinas y ampliar su negocio. Es su 11avo crédito con MFP y una vez más esta feliz por este aporte ya que así podrá desarrollar su negocio. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará más productos de belleza, para sí poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad para elegir.
texts.en:
Sonia is 49 years old.  She is an enterprising mother who lives in her own home with her husband and their 3 children.  After carrying out her housework, Sonia spends her time selling beauty products, offering these products to her friends and others in her neighborhood.  Every afternoon she visits her customers to offer the merchandise which she has.  Her customers make their orders through a catalog.  She feels that her work is very profitable, above all when it comes to the campaigns which the company runs because when she makes more than a certain number of orders she is rewarded with more products for free.  This allows her to make additional income.  For this reason, she is always attentive to her customers, providing them with appropriate guidance on the products which they are going to buy.  Over time, she would like to buy display cases and expand her business.  

This is Sonia's 11th loan with MFP and once more she is happy with the support since it will help her to develop her business.  She will use the loan to buy more beauty products so that she can offer her customers a better variety of products to choose from.

loans.use: To stock up with beauty products so that she has more variety to offer her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts for cars

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es: Cecilio Gutiérrez Dávila, es un padre de familia que se ha desempeñado en la construcción de casas, durante 15 años realizando casas encantadoras para familiares  y amigos en diferentes zonas del país. El solicita un préstamo de ₡604.000 (seiscientos cuatro mil colones), que le permita invertir en la compra de una batidora de cemento y de algunas herramientas para fortalecer su desempeño como albañil y a la vez, brindar un mejor servicio a los clientes.  Es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 empresas asociadas por EDESA.
texts.en: Cecilio Gutiérrez Dávila is a father who works building houses.  For 15 years he has been building beautiful houses for family members and friends in different areas of the country.  He is requesting a loan for 604,000 colones which will allow him to invest in buying a cement mixer and other tools to strengthen his work as a builder and, at the same time, provide a better service to his customers.  He is a member of ' Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete', one of 100 companies associated with EDESA.

loans.use: To buy a cement mixer and mortar

loans.name: Rebeca Delfina

texts.es:
Rebeca Delfina Z. L. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de carne, verduras y pollo desde hace tiempo. Ella inicio con este negocio para sacar adelante a sus dos pequeños y sobre vivir ante la crisis de empleo que hay.
Ella sueña con expandir su negocio y que crezca.
texts.en:
Rebeca Delfina Z. L. is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has been selling meat, vegetables and chicken for some time.  She started this business to get her two little ones ahead in life and to survive in the face of the jobs crisis.

She dreams of expanding her business and helping it grow.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables and chicken

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To help support his growing landscape business

loans.name: Jonas

texts.es:
Jonas de 64 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive con su esposa y dos hijos   en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Hace 8 años por el sector donde vivía no existía ninguna tienda o lugar donde comprar víveres fue por ello que ella decidió tener la primera tienda del sector para tener ingresos y poder mantener a su familia. Comenzó vendiendo dulces en la ventana de su casa poco a poco surtió su negocio. En la actualidad tiene su tienda de víveres y trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 18h00pm vendiendo arroz, enlatados, bebidas, granos etc. Para seguir con el negocio y surtir más su tienda él quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azucar, dulces, enlatados. 

Sus aspiraciones para el futuro es que quiere que su tienda este mas surtida y grande, también quiere comercializar pollos para tener un ingreso adicional.
texts.en:
Jonas is 64 years old.  He has a small grocery store in the front of his home.  He lives with his wife and two children in Playas canton, one of the tourist destinations of Ecuador which is noted for its large variety of seafood.

Eight years ago there was no store or place to buy groceries in the area where Jonas lives.  For that reason, he decided to set up the first store in the area so that he could make income and support his family.  He began selling sweets from the window of his house and little by little he stocked his store.  He currently has a grocery store and works there from 7.00am to 6.00pm selling rice, canned goods, drinks, grains, etc.  To continue with his business and better stock his store, he would like to use his loan to buy rice, sugar, sweets and canned goods.

His aspirations for the future are for his store to be better stocked and bigger.  He would also like to sell chickens to make an additional income.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Señor De Cachuy Group

texts.es:
