Cecilia Paola P. S., Tesorera de la ALCOM: "Señor de Cachuy" (en la foto es la cuarta persona empezando por la derecha y esta vestida de chompa color negro).
Cecilia con tan solo 19 años se enamorò de quien seria el padre de su hijo, el efectivo policial, Teniente Rojas; ellos habian hecho planes para el futuro y los preparativos para su boda, pero lamentablemente un mes antes de su boda, el efectivo policial fuè asesinado en el servicio de su deber. Ella para ese entonces ya estaba gestando de su ùnico hijo Patric.
Cecilia quedò desamparada en todo sentido, ya que al no casarse no pudo reclamar pensiòn del padre de su hijo; pues por ley no le correspondìa.
Cecilia tuvo que hacer cuanto trabajo pudo desempeñar para que no le faltara nada a su pequeño. Actualmente es una vendedora de comida ambulante y adicionalmente viaja a la cuidad de Cañete para ayudar a su hermano que tiene una panaderia.
El prèstamo solicitado es para adicionar a su negocio de comida, la venta de bebidas gaseosas.
texts.en:
Cecilia Paola P. S. is the treasurer of the 'Señor de Cachuy' community bank (in the photo she is the fourth person from the right and is wearing a black sweater).

At only 19 years old, Cecilia fell in love with the man who would become the father of her child, the policeman Lieutenant Rojas.  They had made plans for their future and for their wedding but sadly one month before the wedding he was killed in the line of duty.  At that time, she was pregnant with her only child Patric.

Cecilia was abandoned in all senses as, because she wasn't married, the law stated that she couldn't claim her fiancé's pension.

Cecilia had to work as hard as she could so that her little one didn't want for anything.  Currently she sells food as a street trader and she also travels to the city of Cañete to help her brother who owns a bakery.

She will use her loan to add to her food business by starting to sell sodas.

loans.use: To stock her business with sodas

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia A. B. es una señora de 56 años, ella es la orgullosa dueña de la Tienda de abarrotes “A.”. 
Hace 18 años que abrió su pulpería (tienda general),  sin embargo su negocio no ha crecido lo suficiente por falta de inversión. Es por esa que ella necesita un préstamo de  ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra  de  abarrotes  y verdulería, además de otros suministros generales  que necesita para bridar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 
Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Credifácil RG S.A
texts.en:
Julia A. B. is a 56 year old lady.  She is the proud owner of “A.” grocery store.

She opened her small grocery store 18 years ago but her business hasn't grown enough due to lack of investment.  This is why she needs a loan for 500,000 colones, so that she can buy groceries and fruit and veg, as well as other general supplies which she needs to provide a better service to her customers.

Julia is a member of the community credit company 'Credifácil R.G.S.A'.

loans.use: To buy groceries, fruit and veg and other supplies

loans.name: Sonia Laura

texts.es:
Sonia de 33 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive con su esposa (aparece en la foto) y 4 hijos  en un cantón llamado Playas (Posorja) uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Hace 2 años por el sector donde vivía no existía ninguna tienda de víveres fue por ello que decidió tener la primera tienda del sector para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su familia. Comenzó a vender arroz, azúcar, aceite, granos en la ventana de su casa  poco a poco surtió sus víveres. En la actualidad tiene su tienda de víveres y trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm vendiendo arroz, enlatados, bebidas, granos, legumbres, frutas etc. Para seguir con el negocio y surtir más su tienda él quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, legumbres, enlatados. 

Sus sueño para el futuro es que quiere que su tienda este mas surtida y grande, y darle una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia is 33 years old.  She has a grocery store in the front of her home.  She lives with her husband (who appears in the photo) and their 4 children in Playas (Posorja) canton, one of Ecuador's tourist destinations which is noted for its large variety of seafood.

Two years ago there was no grocery store in the area where she lives, so she decided to have the first store in the area so that she could help her husband with their family expenses.  She began selling rice, sugar, oil and grains from the window of her house and little by little stocked her store with groceries.  She currently has a grocery store and works there from 8.00am to 8.00pm selling rice, canned goods, drinks, grains, vegetables and fruit, etc.  To continue with her business and better stock her store she would like to use her loan to buy rice, vegetables and canned goods.

Her dream for the future is for her store to be bigger and better stocked.  She also dreams of getting her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy rice, vegetables and canned goods

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina tiene 41 años, vive al lado de su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia. Desde hace 17 años se dedica a la crianza de animales, ya que se encarga en la venta de estos animales, siendo previamente comprados a un menor precio y en etapa de desarrollo, para luego ser alimentados, hasta engordarlos y luego venderlos a un mayor precio. En tanto las vacas que tiene, extrae la leche para ser vendidos a sus vecinos, de esa manera obtienen ganancias extras. En ocasiones sus hijos la apoyan en la crianza de sus animales, de esa manera le facilita para que pueda cuidar de sus sembríos de papa, maíz y pastos, éste último que sirve de forraje para sus animales. A lo largo de estos años ha visto como se ha desarrollado su trabajo, y por tal, espera ampliar su establo, además de adquirir vacas y toros de buena raza. Es el crédito número 11 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de  sacos de abono para sembrar pastos y también una vaca de buena raza para lo cual el crédito será una parte de lo que necesita ya que la otra proviene de sus propios recursos.
texts.en:
Delfina is 41 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and three children.  She has been raising animals for 17 years.  She buys her animals at a low price and early stage of development to then fatten them and sell them at a higher price.  She also milks her cows to sell to her neighbors which earns her some extra income.  Sometimes her children help her in raising her animals which leaves her free to look after her potato, corn and grass crops.  The grass crops serve as fodder for her animals.  Throughout the years, Delfina has seen how her work has developed and she therefore would like to expand her stable and acquire cows and bulls of good breed.

This is Delfina's 11th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and likes being part of her community bank because all the members are people who she knows.  They are responsible and very supportive of each other.  She thanks those who will help fund her loan since it will be very useful in making progress in her business.  She will use her loan to invest in buying sacks of fertilizer to grow fodder and also to buy a cow of good breed.  The loan will be part of the money she needs and the rest will come from her own resources.

loans.use: To buy a cow and sacks of fertilizer for her pasture

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su décimo cuarto ciclo. 
Es un grupo que se encuentra  trabajando para salir delante de manera  muy responsable, cada una de  las integrantes tienen sus actividades en donde trabajan. 
La Sra. Graciela R. es una de las integrantes, es una persona que se dedica a varias actividades como por ejemplo, venta de comidas, de ropa los fines de semana. 
 Ella es una madre soltera que mantiene a sus hijos con su trabajo.  Es una mujer muy trabajadora, que lucha día a día para sacar adelante a su familia, solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para sus comestibles y también ropas para la temporada que entra.
texts.en:
This group are in their 14th loan cycle.

This is a group which is working to get ahead in a very responsible way.  Each one of its members has her own business activity.

Mrs Graciela R. is one of the members.  She works in a number of activities such as, for example, selling food and also clothes on a weekend.  She is a single mother who supports her children through her work.  She is a very hard-working woman who works hard every day to get her family ahead in life.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making her food and also clothes for the coming season.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making food and also clothes

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda; tiene 46 años de edad, y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta y producción  de artesanía, ella vende en forma independiente y otras artesanías como collares y aretes los realiza y luego lo distribuye a las demás tiendas de artesanía, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como chompas, mantas y chalinas.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “LOS DIAMANTES” (“The Diamonds”) cooperative bank; the bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the department and province of Cusco.

The member is Ms. Hilda; she is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children.  She alternates her daily activities between making and selling handicrafts.  She sells independently, including other handicrafts such as necklaces and earrings.  She makes her products and then distributes them among crafts stores.

She would like to expand and improve her business.  She requests the loan in order to buy handmade items such as sweaters, blankets and scarves.

The member is thankful for the loan, and commits to making her installment payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase handicrafts such as sweaters, blankets and scarves.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
El señor Faustino I. M. tiene de 58 años de edad, es soltero y tiene 1 hijo que depende de el, los demas hijos viven en los estados unidos, Faustino se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, tambien se dedica a destazar cerdos los fines de semana.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio y tambien para comprar cerdos, se aproxima la navidad y la carne de cerdo es muy buscada por las personas para la cena de navidad.
tambien quiere tener surtida su pulperia porque es cuando las personas compran mas.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su hijo.
texts.en:
Faustino I. M. is 58 years old, single, and has 1 son who depends on him.  The rest of his children are married.  Faustino dedicates himself to selling popular consumer goods, and has a grocery store in his home.  He also butchers pigs on weekends.  

The loan will be used to buy merchandise to better supply his business, and also to buy pigs.  Christmas is approaching, and pork is in high demand by people for their holiday meals.  

He would also like to supply his store, because customers purchase more items during this season.  He will use his profits to help himself and his son get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase pigs, rice, beans, sugar, lard, cornmeal, oil, margarine, soups, pastas, cereal, soaps, toilet paper, toothpaste, sanitary napkins, bread, cookies, churros, sardines, juices, dairy products, razors, condiments, salt.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Walter; el tiene 30 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de carpintería metalica, el tiene un taller donde realiza diferentes trabajos como ventanas, puertas y sillas, el trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, el socio quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de taller mecánica. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar una maquina de soldadura.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “LOS LIDERES” (“The Leaders”) cooperative bank; the bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Walter; he is 30 years old and single.  He alternates his daily activities with the business of metalwork.  He has a workshop where he completes projects such as windows, doors, and sills.  He works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  The member would like to improve and expand his metalwork business.  He seeks a loan in order to buy a welding machine.

He gives thanks to those who become part of his dream via this medium, and commits to making his loan payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: To purchase a welding machine.

loans.name: Kikas Group

texts.es:
El grupo que a continuación presento se llama "Kikas", es un grupo pequeño pero muy unido y los integrantes se conocen desde hace varios años, decidieron ponerle al grupo Kikas por que  es como en el pueblo conocen a las hijas de la señora Jazmín, que es la representante del grupo, Kikas está integrado por seis personas que son las siguientes:

1.- Jazmín A. G. de 29 años 
2.- Gelacio G. S. de 35 años
3.-Ambrocio G. S. de 38 años
4.-Ana Luisa M. N.  de 35 años
5.-Marcelina T. C.    de 29 años
6.-Cecilia García T.        de 21 años

Las 6 personas mencionadas son vecinos y amigos de la comunidad, integraron este grupo por que cada persona da buenas referencias del otro integrante, la comunidad en la que viven es una comunidad muy humilde donde por lo regular la actividad economica de la gente la tiene en el campo y criando animales como: vacas, pollos y borregos, es la unica actividad que la gente conoce y con la que se relaciona, las señoras son en general amas de casa y no es la exepción con las mujeres de este grupo, pero son mujers que quieren salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo con el gasto y los hijos, como es el caso de Doña Jazmín.

Doña Jazmín, aparece en la foto a mano derecha vestiendo una sudadera roja con un numero 53 en el pecho, es una señora muy trabajadora, está casada tiene 10 años viviendo con su esposo y es madre de 4 hijos:

La mayor es mujer y tiene 11 años estudia la primaria, y nos cuenta que es muy inteligente y es una niña aplicada, despues viene otra niña que tiene 9 años de edad, tambien estudia la primaria y va en la misma esceula que su hermana mayor, de ella nos platica que se le dificulta las matematicas, de la niña sigue un hijo que es varon y tiene solo 2 años de edad y una ultima que es niña con un año.

Doña Jazmín tiene casa propia lo que la tranquiliza mucho por que no paga renta y como sea sería un gasto más en su familia, su esposo trabaja como ayudante de mecanico nos cuenta que no gana mucho y quisiera salirse de trabajar para ganar un poco más de dinero, no se ha salido de trabajar por que sería dificil que el señor encuentre un trabajo ya que no tiene la secundaria terminada y en estos tiempos como minimo piden la preparatoria, es una situación dificil como vive la familia de doña Jazmín pero ella quiere echarle muchas ganas, no darse por vencida por que están sus hijas y por ellas quiere hacer la lucha.

Por este  motivo tan grande ella inicio un negocio que es pequeño pero de igual manera hay ganancias, Doña Jazmín vende Jarceria, que es el negocio de plastico, todo lo que este echo con plastico es la jarceria, por ejemplo, botes para la basura, tinacos, vandejas, cucharas, sillas, mesas etc. Lo que doña Jazmin hace es comprar estos productos por docenas y llegar a su comunidad a venderlos casa por casa, está realizando una actividad dificil por que caminar cargando varios productos y encima un bebe de un año no cualquier mujer se animaria hacerlo.

Pero es el pan de cada dia de doña Jazmín, no se desanima si no alcontrario quiere salir adelante lo hace pensando en sus hijos y en un mejor futuro para ellos. Doña Jazmín junto su grupo, son integrantes de confianza , vecinos y gente trabajadora que al igual que doña Jazmín buscan salir adelante y apoyar en su casa, para eso solicitaron su credito, doña Jazmín lo piensa invertir y comprar mercancia en docena, por que sale más barato comprar por docena ó por juegos, al momento que compra por docena lleva ya una ganancia de por medio. 

Los demas integrantes de Kikas, se dedican a lo siguiente: Don Gelacio y don Ambrocio tienen la actividad de ganaderia ellos dos solicitaron el prestamo para comprar un par de vacas y puedan dar crias en un futuro, la Sr. Ana Luisa vende prodcutos por catalogo en este caso es la ropa, pero no tenia para estar invirtiendo y se animo a pedir el apoyo, La Sr. Marcelina y Cecilia se dedican al comercio tienen en un mercado un local de comida corrida que habren diario. 

Este es el grupo de doña Jazmín son seis integrantes con actividades economicas un poco diferentes y con ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group presented in the following description is called “Kikas”.  It is a small group, but a very united one, and the members have known each other for several years.  They decided to call themselves Kikas because, in their town, it is how Jazmín’s daughters are known.  She is the group’s representative, and there are six members in the group:  

1.- Jazmín A. G., 29 years old 
2.- Gelacio G. S., 35 years old
 3.-Ambrocio G. S., 38 years old
 4.-Ana Luisa M. N., 35 years old 
5.-Marcelina T. C., 29 years old 
6.-Cecilia García T., 21 years old

The 6 people mentioned are neighbors and friends in the community.  They formed the group because each person had good references from another member.  The community where they live is very humble and a place where, in general, people earn a living farming or raising animals such as:  cows, chickens and sheep.  These are the activities the people know and can relate to.  Most women are homemakers, and the women in this group are no exception.  However, they are women that want to get ahead and support their husbands with the household and children expenses.  This is also the case with Jazmín.

Jazmín appears on the right side of the photograph, wearing a red sweatshirt with the number 53.  She is a very hard-working woman, married for 10 years, who lives with her husband and 4 children:

The oldest is an 11-year old daughter who is in primary school.  She tells us she is very smart, and a young girl who applies herself.  After her, is a 9-year old daughter who is also in primary school and attends the same school as her older sister.  She tells us she has difficulty with math.  After this daughter comes a son who is only 2, and another daughter, who is 1.

Jazmín owns her house, a fact that gives her some peace because she doesn’t have to pay rent, which would be one more household expense.  Her husband works as a mechanic’s assistant, but she tells us he doesn’t earn much.  He hasn’t left this work because it would be difficult for him to find a job earning more money since he didn’t finish secondary school.  These days, employers are requiring at least having completed preparatory school.  Jazmín’s family lives in a difficult situation, but she wants to put forth great effort and not see herself defeated.  She wants to forge ahead for her daughters.  For this reason, she started with a small business, which, all the same, generates income.  Jazmín sells “jarceria”, which is the business of selling plastic goods.  Jarceria is everything that has to do with plastics.  For example, trash bins, water tanks, buckets, spoons, chairs, tables, etc.  What Jazmín does is buy these products by the dozen, and returns to her community to sell them door-to-door.  This is a tough job, because she has to carry her products, along with her 1-year old baby, and no ordinary woman would be motivated to do this.

However, this is Jazmín’s daily bread, and she doesn’t get discouraged; rather, to the contrary, she wants to get ahead and thinks only of her children and of providing them with a brighter future.  

Jazmín, along with her group, are trustworthy members, neighbors, and hard-working people who, like Jazmín, seek to get ahead and support their households.  This is why they’ve requested a loan.  Jazmín is thinking about investing her loan into buying merchandise by the dozen, because it is cheaper to buy by the dozen or in sets.  From the moment she buys in bulk, she is making a profit via this means.

The other members of Kikas devote themselves to the following:  Mr. Gelacio and Mr. Ambrocio raise livestock, and these two have requested the loan to buy cows who might yield calves in the future.  Ms. Ana Luisa sells catalog items, in this case clothing, but she didn’t have the funds to continue investing in her business, which motivated her to seek support.  Ms. Marcelina and Ms. Cecilia dedicate themselves to commerce at a food stand they open on a daily basis at a local market.

This is Jazmín’s group.  They are six members with slightly different activities, but who all yearn to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy plastic goods by the dozen, such as:  bins, tanks, buckets, chairs, tables, etc.

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Mómica B. con su primer credikiva le fué muy bien y ha planeado renovarlo porque necesita proveer su negocio para el mes de Diciembre , ella dice que ha contado por parte de la Fudación Mario Santo Domingo con una buena asesoria y buen servicio, ahora quiere acceder al mercado de estudiantes de los colegios de sus alrededores y va a comprar con su nuevo credikiva comestibles y dulcería que finamente empacará y que ofrecerá a sus clientes, para que sea comprado como un regalo navideño económico y agradable para obsequiar a sus amigos en estas festividades de fin de año. 
Si quiere conocer mas sobre la historia de Mónica puede acceder al siguiente enlace:

http://kiva.org/lend/193541
texts.en:
Mónica B.’s first Kiva loan went very well, and she has planned to renew it because she needs to supply her business for the month of December.  She tells us that she has counted on Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for good counsel and service.

Currently, she would like to access the market of students from the surrounding schools.  She will use her new Kiva loan to buy food and sweets that she will package nicely.  Her hope is that her products will be purchased as economical and enjoyable Christmas gifts that the students can offer to their friends for the holiday season.

More information about Mónica’s history can be accessed at the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/193541

loans.use: To buy food and sweets that she will package nicely to offer to customers, so they can purchase them as economical and enjoyable Christmas gifts.

loans.name: Luz Idalia

texts.es:
la señora Luz Idalia R. tiene de 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos, los cuales los tiene estudiando.
sus hijos le ayudan en la limpieza de la casa.
Luz Idalia sale a vender su ropa de manera ambulante.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa interior, jeans, camisas y blusas. tiene muchos clientes que le compran al credito y le estan encargando ropa para la navidad, en esta epoca es cuando ella mas vende su mercaderia.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
Su mayor deseo es que sus hijos se graduen del colegio y que sigan estudiando en la universidad para que sean buenos profesionales y hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Luz Idalia R. is 49 years of age. She is a single mother and lives with her two sons whom she has in school. Her sons help out at home with the cleaning. 

Luz Idalia sells clothing as a street vendor. She will use the loan to purchase underwear, jeans, shirts and blouses. She has many customers who buy from her on credit and now they are ordering clothing for Christmas. This is the season when she sells more merchandise. 

She needs the earnings to cover household expenses and the costs of schooling her children. Her greatest wish is that her sons would graduate from high school and continue studying at a university so that they may be good professionals and decent men.

loans.use: To purchase underwear, jeans, shirts, blouses

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Celia; tiene 56 años de edad, y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, la socia atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, ella prepara diferentes platos como desayunos y almuerzos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio y tener un horno para hacer pollo. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Celia belongs to the “Los Diamantes” (Diamonds) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Celia is 56 years old.  She is married and has 2 children.  She divides her daily activities with her restaurant business.  She serves in her restaurant from 7.00am to 4.000pm and through her business she gets her children ahead in life.  She prepares different dishes, breakfasts and lunches.  She would like to expand her business and have an oven where she can make chicken.  She is requesting this loan to buy cooking products.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy cooking products

loans.name: Ayudanos Señor 1, 4 & 5 Group

texts.es:
Lucienne es una D. los miembros del Grupo Ayudanos Señor 1,4,5. Grupo cuya mayoria D. sus miembros son Dominico - haitiano o emigrantes D. Haiti que viven en los bateyes D. L. Ciudad D. Romana, una D. las ciudades turistica D. Republica Dominicano, con una alta escaL. D. lujo, D. donD. deriva su economia junto a una D. las mas granD. industrias D. azucar. Su negocio es vender comida, por lo que cocina para distribuir a trabajadores y a vender en su casa a sus vecinos.  ElL. es madre D. 2 hijos. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil es enviar a sus hijos a L. universidad y que disfruta asistir a L. Iglesia.

Lucienne está muy emocionada D. recibir su 4to. préstamo en Esperanza Internacional e invertido en su negocio con el cual lleva ya alrededor D. 10 años. Está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en L. compra D. diferentes ingredientes para cocinar como arroz, aceite, habichueL., carnes, vegetales, entre otros. Su sueño es poder expandir su negocio establecido.
texts.en:
Lucienne is one of the members of the “Ayúdanos Señor 1,4,5” (Help Us Lord 1,4,5) group.  The majority of the group's members are Dominican-Haitians or emigrants from Haiti who live in 'bateyes' (company towns where sugar workers live) in the town of Romana, one of the Dominican Republic's touriS.destinations which has a high scale of luxury.  The town's economy is based on the touriS.industry as well as one of the biggeS.sugar factories.  Lucienne's business is selling food which she cooks to distribute to the workers and to sell from her home to her neighbors.  She has 2 children.  She tells us that her biggeS.challenge is sending her children to university and that she enjoys going to church.

Lucienne is very excited to be receiving her 4th loan from Esperanza Internacional and will inveS.it in her business which she has had for about 10 years.  She is planning to inveS.her loan in buying different cooking ingredients such as rice, oil, beans, meat, vegetables, etc.  Her dream is to be able to expand her established business.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, flour, vegetables, etc.

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Karina; tiene 25 años de edad, y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de adornos navideños, la socia venderá adornos en una feria que se realiza todas las navidades y también ella estudia biología en la universidad y por medio de este pequeño negocio que realizara pagara las mensualidades de la universidad, ella quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de adornos para navidad. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de adornos de navidad.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the “Los Diamantes” (Diamonds) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Karina is 25 years old and she is single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling Christmas decorations.  She will sell decorations in a market which takes place every Christmas period.  She is also studying biology at university and will use this small business to make her monthly payments to the university.  She would like to improve her business selling Christmas decorations.  She is requesting this loan to buy Christmas decorations.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy Christmas decorations

loans.name: Clisanta

texts.es:
doña Clisanta E. B. tiene 61 años de edad es viuda y se dedica a la venta de productos de comsumo diario como ser frijoles, arroz, azucar, cafe, jabon, papel higienico etc.
toda via tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria para surtir su negocio, ya que en estos momentos esta pasando por una situacion dificil y no tiene capital para comprar mercaderia.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
su meta es poder hacer crecer su pulperia.
texts.en:
Ms. Clisanta E. B. is 61 years of age and a widow. She earns a living by selling products of daily consumption such as beans, rice, sugar, coffee, soap, toilet paper, etc. She still has two children who are dependent on her. 

She will use the loan to purchase groceries to supply her business as currently she is going through a difficult situation and does not have the capital to purchase merchandise. 

She needs the earnings to cover the costs of the household. Her goal is to be able to make her grocery store grow.

loans.use: To purchase eggs, drinks, rice, beans, sugar, lard, coffee, oil, soaps, toilet paper, salt, pastries, cornmeal

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Americo; el tiene 36 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con servicio de taxi, el tiene un carro donde hace servicio de taxi a las diferentes calles del cusco, el socio quiere ahorrar y por medio de este trabajo poder salir adelante, el socio quiere mejorar el carro para que pueda brindar un mejor servicio de taxi. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the village bank "Los Líderes" [The Leaders] which is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco. 

The member is Americo who is 36 years of age and single. The member intersperses his daily activities with taxi services. He has a car with which he provides taxi services in the various streets of Cusco. The member wants to save and get ahead by means of this work. He wants to make improvements to the car in order to be able to offer a better taxi service. The member is seeking the loan for the maintenance of his car. 

The member appreciates those who make up part of this dream in this way and promises to make his payments within the established time period.

loans.use: For maintenance of his car

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana lives in Lahore, famous for its history and culture. She lives there with her family in a 2-room brick house. Farzana is a very caring and supportive lady. She supports her family financially by doing embroidery work. To earn an income, she receives orders from her neighborhood clients and completes the orders on time. 

Her husband is a private entrepreneur and makes beautiful colored jewelry boxes. He makes the boxes from wood and glass, which give an attractive look to his work. His clientele are jewelry sellers. He is very skillful in his art and receives regular orders every month. Timely delivery of products is the key to a successful business and her husband follows this.

Farzana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy glass and wood in larger quantities, which will help him to make more jewelry boxes to fulfill the orders of his customers. 

Farzana is hopeful that her husband will successfully be able to improve his business with the help of a loan investment.

loans.use: To buy wood and glass for jewelry box business

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es:
El Sr. Ángel R. es casado, tiene 57 años de edad, con 4 hijos. Se dedica al macate (Ventas de sobrecamas, hamacas), dicha actividad aprendió de sus padres, pues, la mayoría de la zona son macateros y lo realizan desde temprana edad. Él empezó con un pequeño capital que le habían prestado sus parientes,  hoy día ya tiene clientela formada y ha logrado tener su casa propia con  el esfuerzo de día a día.

 Dos de sus hijas mayores trabajan en  Argentina a quienes también le proveen de mercaderías, razón por el cual necesita un apoyo constante de capital, ellas también le ayudan en las ventas y así poco a poco va mejorando su calidad de vida.

 El señor Ángel es muy trabajador, además, de macatear también se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva Maíz y Mandioca para consumo.

 Su máximo sueño es que pueda tener ingreso suficiente para no depender de sus hijos, y pueda trabajar siempre en forma independiente. Es su segunda solicitud, la primera pagó en forma excelente y espera beneficiarse más con los créditos.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de sobrecamas, hamacas e hilos.
texts.en:
Ángel R. is married.  He is 57 years old and has 4 children.  He is a travelling salesman (selling quilts and hammocks).  He learned this activity from his parents.  Most people in his area are travelling salesmen and carry out their trade from an early age.  He began with a small amount of capital which his relatives had loaned him.  He now has an established customer base and has managed to acquire his own home through the hard work he does every day.

Two of his older daughters work in Argentina.  They provide him with merchandise which is why he needs a constant support of capital.  They also help him with his sales and little by little they improve their quality of life.

Ángel is a very hard-working man.  As well as being a travelling salesman, he also farms.  He grows corn and cassava to eat.

His biggest dream is to have enough income so that he doesn't have to depend on his children any more and so that he can always work independently.  This is his second loan request.  He paid his first loan off excellently and hopes to benefit from further loans in the future.

He is requesting his loan to buy quilts, hammocks and threads.

loans.use: To buy quilts, hammocks, different colored threads, etc.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with an 8-year-old son, Igor. She is a farmer from Kamenka which is a predominantly rural agricultural region of Ukraine. Yelena owns two big arch greenhouses where she grows early spring vegetables like tomatoes and radishes, for further wholesale and retail sale. Yelena is relatively new to this sphere of business. She built her first greenhouse only 2 years ago. However, she has already invested 90,000 Grivnyas in her venture. She spends 25,000 Grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene film every year. 

Yelena is requesting a 15,000 Grivnya loan to construct a greenhouse and buy good quality plastic film for extra durability and good light transmission in her greenhouses.  Yelena is hoping to continue expanding her enterprise and re-invest profit in further growth of her business. She is planning to build one more greenhouse in the nearest future, thus having four greenhouses altogether.

loans.use: to construct a new greenhouse and purchase polyethylene film

loans.name: Sara Concepcion

texts.es:
la sra. Sara Concepcion C. O. tiene 32 años de edad y se dedica a la compra y venta de lacteos como ser: quesillo, queso y mantequilla.
sus ventas son todos los dias, pero tiene mas ventas los fines de semana.
Los lacteos que se producen en la ciudad de San Lorenzo son de muy buena calidad y sabor, se venden muy rapido.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de lacteos al por mayor y asi tener mejores ventas y mayores ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
Sara es una mujer con muchos deseos de superacion.
texts.en:
Mrs Sara Concepcion C. O. is 32 years old.  She buys and sells dairy products such as 'quesillo' (a type of soft cheese found throughout Central America), cheese and butter.

She sells her products every day but sells most on a weekend.

The dairy products which are produced in the town of San Lorenzo are very good quality and taste good.  They sell very quickly.

She will use her loan to buy dairy products wholesale to obtain better sales and better profits which she needs to cover her household expenses.

Sara is a woman who has a great desire to better herself.

loans.use: To buy cheese, 'quesillo' (soft cheese) and butter

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Mariano; el tiene 48 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con servicio de taxi, el es propietario de un carro donde realiza el servicio de taxi a diferentes calles de la ciudad del Cusco, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de taxi. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro y comprar algunos repuestos.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mariano belongs to the “Los Líderes” (Leaders) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Mariano is 48 years old.  He is single and has 2 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business as a taxi driver.  He owns his own car which he uses to provide a taxi service in different streets of the city of Cusco.  He would like to improve his taxi service.  He is requesting this loan to have maintenance work done on his vehicle and to buy some spare parts.

He is grateful to those who will take part in his dream by funding his loan and he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To have maintenance work done on his car and to buy some spare parts

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Carlos Alberto; el tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, el vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y fideos, el socio atiende desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, el socio quiere mejorar y ampliar la tienda de abarrotes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar y galletas al por mayor.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Alberto is a member of the communal bank “Los Lideres” [The Leaders] which is in Cusco District, Province of Cusco in the Department of Cusco.  

He is 35 years old and lives with his common-law wife and their two children. His time is divided between his daily activities and working at his grocery store. He works from 5:00am until 10:00pm selling staples like rice, sugar and pasta. 

He would like to improve and enlarge his store and requests the loan to buy produce like rice, sugar and crackers wholesale. He would like to thank the people who will contribute to his dream and he has committed himself to pay the loan back in a timely manner.

loans.use: The member requests the loan to buy produce wholesale like rice, sugar, crackers

loans.name: Dmytro

texts.en:
Dmytro is married with 3 children. He lives in Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Dmytro sells furniture, i.e. couches, armchairs, tables, etc. His store is located in a busy part of town. As Dmytro has been in the market for over 6 years, he has gained loyal customers. People know he sells quality furniture pieces and come to buy necessary items from him.  

Dmytro has already invested 60,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His monthly net profit amounts to 6,000 Grivnyas. Dmytro is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for his little store. He is friends with his suppliers who manufacture furniture. He always buys from them, knowing they have not let him down a single time.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Benicio Alcidez

texts.es:
el sr. Benicio S. tiene 30 años de edad y se dedica a la crianza de cerdos para venta, es una persona muy activa y tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante.
en esta epoca de navidad se vende mucho el cerdo porque es una de las carnes preferidas para la cena navideña, ahora ya tiene muchos cerdos encargados para vender.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cerdos y para alimento de cerdos.
espera vender muchos cerdos para la navidad y tener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Benicio S. is 30 years old and he raises pigs to sell. He is a very active person and wishes to keep moving forward.

During the Christmas holidays pigs sell well because pork is one of the favorite meats for Christmas dinner. His costumers have already placed several orders.

He will utilize the loan to buy more pigs and their feed and hopes to have good sales during the holidays to obtain strong profits.

loans.use: To buy pigs and their feed

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Danila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Danila; tiene 48 años de edad, y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta juguetes, ella vende en el comercial el Molino, la socia vende todo tipo de juguetes, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de juguetes. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar juguetes al por mayor.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ms. Danila is a member of the communal bank “Los Diamantes” [The Diamonds] which is in Cusco District, Province of Cusco in the Department of Cusco.  

She is 48 years old, a single mother and has two children. Her time is divided between the daily chores and selling toys at the market.  She works from 8:00am until 7:00pm selling all kinds of toys at Comercial el Molino [The Molino Market]. She is able to provide for her children through her work.  She would like to expand and buy toys wholesale with the money requested.

The member is grateful for the loan and has committed herself to pay it on a timely manner.

loans.use: The member requests the loan to buy toys wholesale.

loans.name: Nargis' Group

texts.en:
Nargis has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband who is a tailor by profession. He operates his shop in the market and attracts a good number of clients every month. He is known in his area for his quality and timely delivery of finished work. 

She lives in an area named Yadgar with her family in a 2-room brick house. It is located in Lahore which is the second largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. She herself is a housewife, spending most of her time staying at home and doing her household work. She is a very responsible person and fulfills her responsibilities very well. 

With the loan, her husband will buy another sewing machine and hire a worker who will help him in completing his work on timely basis. Marriage season is on the way and Nargis is hopeful that after a loan investment, her husband will be able to earn larger profits from his business and to improve the financial conditions of his family.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine for tailoring business

loans.name: Kuña  Rory Group

texts.es:
Este comité se denomina “Kuña Rory”, se encuentra dentro del 10 ciclo del Programa de comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Todas las integrantes son señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, ellas se dedican diversas actividades .
     Algunas de las integrantes ya contaban con trabajo antes de formar parte del comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y se integraron para lograr mejorar su emprendimiento, otras sin embargo comienzan con su primera actividad ajena a los que  se refiere su familia.
     Las mujeres Agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por la iniciativa ya que mediante ella logramos desarrollar bastante nuestra capacidad de trabajo.
     Todas realizan actividades independientes, pero con ayuda y esfuerzo lo realizan en forma conjunta.
El comité lo conforman mujeres muy sacrificadas que han luchado toda su vida para llevar adelante a sus familiares a pesar de los obstáculos que siempre existen.
 Se puede comentar el caso de la Sra  Dionicia  quien se dedica hace varios años a la venta de leche y verduras, ella se levanta muy temprano a ordeñar  su vaca para salir a vender.
 La venta lo realiza en la ciudad de Carapegua en donde tiene un puesto de venta de verduras. 
La Sra. Dionicia agradece de manera especial a la Fundación por que mediante el apoyo brindado por la misma  ella pudo adquirir más capital y así poder agrandar su negocio porque ahora cuenta con más mercaderías y así también con una congeladora.
texts.en:
This committee is called "Kuña Rory" and is in its tenth loan cycle with the Enterprising Women's Committee Program. All the members are very responsible and hardworking women who work at a variety of businesses. 

Some of the members already had work before becoming part of the Enterprising Women's Committee and joined up in order to be able to make improvements in their enterprises. Others however are just starting up their first business activity apart from their responsibilities to family. 

The women appreciate the Fundación Paraguaya for the initiative since it is through the initiative that we are able to see considerable development in our ability to work. 

They all maintain separate businesses but with help and effort they are doing it jointly. 

The committee is made up of self-sacrificing women who have struggled their whole lives to get their families ahead in spite of the obstacles which always exist. 

We may comment on the case of Dionicia who for a number of years has worked selling milk and produce. She gets up very early to milk her cow in order to go out and sell the milk. She sells in the city of Carapegua where she has a vegetable stand. 

Dionicia especially appreciates the Fundación because by means of their support she was able to acquire more capital and thus could expand her business. She now has more merchandise and also a freezer.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and a freezer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more plantains

loans.name: Canal De Bendicion 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Ana es una de los miembros del Grupo Canal de Bendicion 1,2. Grupo cuya mayoria de sus miembros son Dominico - haitiano o emigrantes de Haiti que viven en los bateyes de la Ciudad de Romana, una de las ciudades turistica de Republica Dominicano, con una alta escala de lujo, de donde deriva su economia junto a una de las mas grande industrias de azucar. Su negocio es vender ropas nuevas y usadas, la cual adquiere en los mercados de pulgas ubicados en Santo Domingo o en la frontera con Haiti. Ana es casada y madre de 4 hijos. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil ha sido poder darle una buena educacion a sus hijos.

Ana está muy emocionada de recibir su 1er. préstamo en Esperanza Internacional e invertirlo en su negocio con el cual lleva ya alrededor de 7 años. Está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de varias piezas de ropa nueva y un paquete de ropa usada, para luego verderlas por piezas, utilizara las ganancias de su negocio para reinvertirlo en el mismo. Su sueño es poder expandir su negocio establecido.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the “Canal de Bendición 1,2” group.  Most of the group's members are Dominican-Haitians or emigrants from Haiti who live in 'bateyes' (company towns where sugar workers live) in the town of Romana, one of the Dominican Republic's tourist destinations which has a high scale of luxury.  This is what the town's economy  is based on, together with one of the biggest sugar factories.  Ana's business is selling new and used clothing.  She acquires her clothing in the flea markets of Santo Domingo or on the border with Haiti.  Ana is married and has 4 children.  She tells us that her biggest challenge is being able to provide her kids with a good eduction.

Ana is very excited to be receiving her first loan from Esperanza Internacional and will invest it in her business which she has had for around 7 years.  She is planning to invest her loan in buying various items of new clothing and a packet of used clothing whose items she will then sell individually.  She will use her profits to re-invest in her business.  Her dream is to be able to expand her established business.

loans.use: To buy new and used clothing

loans.name: San Martin De Porras Group

texts.es:
Meliz B. D. C., casada, madre D. familia con 3 hijos mayores D. edad (en la foto es la segunda D. la izquierda, esta vestida D. chompa color gris y con un pañuelo al cuello).
La Señora Meliz està casada con Don Mariano Alberto C. Zurita, quien es su empuje para seguir adelante; a Don Alberto lo operaron D. la garganta, a pesar D. ser jubilado, la pensiòn que recibe no alcanza para cubrir el costo D. los medicamentos que necesita.
La Señora Meliz con la ayuda D. su esposo venD. dulces desD. hace ya 25 años en una carretilla frente al colegio Ricardo Menendez Menendez en Huancayo; gracias a su trabajo pudo educar y alimentar a su familia.
El prèstamo lo invertirà en comprar mas mercaderia para su negocio.
texts.en:
Meliz B. D. C. is married and mother to three adult children (in the photograph she is the second from the left dressed in a gray sweater and wearing a scarf). 

Meliz is married to Mariano Alberto C. Zurita, who is her driving force to keep her moving forward. Alberto had an operation on his throat and in spite of being retired the pension he receives is not enough to cover the cost of the medicines he needs. 

Meliz, with the help of her husband, sells sweets from a cart in front of the Ricardo Menendez Menendez high school in Huancayo which she has done for 25 years. Thanks to this work she was able to educate and feed her family. 

She will invest the loan in purchasing more merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To increase capital for candy sales

loans.name: The Big Five Group

texts.en:
Peter Z., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called The Big Five.  He is 41 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of 4-months and 21 years. Peter was only able to attend school through 12th grade and could not continue due to lack of financial support.

For 6 years, he has been operating a foreign exchange bureau in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 20,000 LRD portion of this 56,000 LRD group loan to add more money to his business. He describes himself as a determined and kind man whose goal is to improve his business.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Oretha is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To add more money to his business

loans.name: Mayra Marlene

texts.es:
Mayra de 41 años, tiene una pequeña papelería muy variada con juguetes y ropa. Vive con sus dos hijos en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes. 

Comenzó con un pequeño capital para tener su propia papeleria y poder mantener a sus hijos ya que es madre soltera. Compro cuadernos, plumas, papelería y los comenzó a vender en un local. Trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 22h30pm en su papelería. Vende los juguetes a $ 5.00 en adelante, ropa segun sea la talla, cuadernos a $ 0.80 c/u.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar juguetes, cuadernos, papelería. En el futuro quiere tener otra papelería y la que tiene ahora que sea la central de papelería mas surtida.
texts.en:
Mayra is 41 years old.  She has a small stationery store which sells a lot of different products including toys and clothes.  She lives with her two children in an urban area called Guasmo which is noted for the fact that most of its residents are salespeople.

She started out with a little bit of capital to obtain her own stationery store and be able to support her children since she is a single mother.  She bought exercise books, pens and stationery items and began selling them from a business premises.  She works from 6.30am to 10.30pm in her store.  She sells toys from $5.00 upwards, clothes according to size and exercise books for $0.80 each.

She will use her loan to buy toys, exercise books and stationery.  In the future, she would like to own another stationery store and for the one she has now to be the best-stocked stationery store.

loans.use: To buy toys and gift bags

loans.name: Juan Arturo

texts.es:
Juan de 30 años, tiene una panadería en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive con su esposa (esta en la foto) y sus dos hijos en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra.  
 
Para darles una mejor vida a sus dos hijos de 3 y 1 año comenzó a comprar levadura, harina, lácteos y empezar a hacer panes con ayuda de su esposa. Poco a poco y con la motivación de sus hijos y esposa ya tiene años con su panadería. Cada pan lo vende a $ 0.10. También tiene dulces que prepara con ayuda de su esposa llamados enroladitos, rosquitas.

Para seguir con su negocio él quiere comprar harina, bebidas, lácteos. En el futuro quiere implementar más dulces para darle una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan, 30, has a bakery in the front part of his house. He lives with his wife (seen in the photo) and their two children in an urbanized area in the el Fortín section of Guayaquil characterized by its dirt roads. 

In order to provide a better life to their two children who are three and one years of age, he began buying yeast, flour and dairy products and started making bread and pastries with the help of his wife. Little by little and inspired by his children and wife he has stayed in business now for years. He sells every roll and pastry for $0.10. He also sells highly sweetened pastries that he prepares with his wife's help called "enroladitos" and "rosquitas" [roll-ups and wheel-shaped]. 

To maintain his business he wants to purchase flour, drinks and dairy products. In the future he wants to incorporate more sweet pastries into his product line in order to give good variety to his customers.

loans.use: To purchase flour, yeast, drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags rice and gallons of oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more blouses and slippers

loans.name: Nixon Cruz

texts.es:
Nixon de 36 años, tiene tres hijos de 7, 5 y 1 años con su esposa trabaja en una tienda de víveres para poder mantener el hogar. Vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra.  

Hace tres años comenzó con su tienda para poder mantener a sus hijos. En la actualidad trabaja con su esposa desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm atendiendo la tienda. En su tienda vende arroz, aceites, enlatados etc. En los tres años que ha tenido la tienda la ha podido surtir gracias al buen trabajo que realiza con su esposa pero uno de los inconvenientes que siempre ha tenido es el polvo que le ocasiona la calle de tierra. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como arroz, enlatados, bebidas para tener más variedad en sus productos. En el futuro quiere surtir más la tienda y que sus hijos tengan los estudios que se merecen.
texts.en:
Nixon is 36 years old.  He has three children aged 7, 5 and 1.  He works together with his wife in a grocery store so that they can support their household.  He lives in a peri-urban area in Fortín de Guayaquil which is noted for its dirt roads.

Three years ago he began working in his store so that he could support his children.  He currently works with his wife from 6.00am to 10.00pm serving in the store.  In the store they sell rice, oil and  canned goods, etc.  In the three years that he has had the store, he has been able to stock it thanks to the good work which he does with his wife.  However, one of the problems which he has always had is the dust which is created by the dirt road outside.

He would like to use his loan to buy groceries such as rice, canned goods and drinks so that he can have more variety in his products.  In the future, he would like to better stock his store and he would like for his children to receive the education which they deserve.

loans.use: To buy rice, chicken and oil

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señorita Ma-Fatima M. domiciliada en el Barrio San Jose de la Ciudad de.
   “Nuevo Amanecer”fue denominado el comité y actualmente se encuentra en la etapa Septimo con 19 integrantes, es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, ellas se dedican diversas actividades.
     Algunas de las integrantes ya contaban con trabajo antes de formar parte D. comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y se integraron para lograr mejorar su emprendimiento, otras sin embargo comienzan con su primera actividad ajena a los que se refiere su familia.
     Las mujeres Agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por la iniciativa ya que mediante ella logramos desarrollar bastante nuestra capacidad de trabajo.
     Todas realizan actividades independientes, pero ayuda y esfuerzo lo realizan en forma conjunta. 
El comité lo conforman mujeres muy sacrificadas que han luchado toda su vida para llevar adelante a sus familiares a pesar de los obstáculos que siempre existen. 
Se puede comentar el caso de la Sra. Agustina quien se dedica hace varios años a la venta de chipa, ella se levanta muy temprano a preparar su chipa para salir a vender. 
La venta lo realiza de forma ambulante  para el recorrido lo ayuda su sobrina y su marido. 
La Sra. Agustina agradece de manera especial a la Fundación por que mediante el apoyo brindado por la misma pudo adquirir más capital y así poder agradar su negocio porque ahora cuenta con más vendedores de chipa, mediante la compra de insumos  como queso, almidón de yuca, harina  de maíz, leñas para la elaboración de chipas.
texts.en:
This committee was set up by Miss Maria Fatima M. in the San José neighborhood of the city.  The committee was named “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) and it is currently in its seventh loan cycle with 19 members.  It is a group of very responsible and hard-working ladies.  They carry out a number of different business activities.

Some of the members already had work before becoming part of the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Enterprising Women) and joined the group so that they could improve their businesses.   Others, however, are just starting out with their first business activity.

The women would like to thank Fundación Paraguaya for the initiative since through it they have managed to develop their ability to work.

All of the members of the group carry out independent business activities but help and hard work are something they share.

The committee is made up of very selfless women who have fought all their lives to get their families ahead in life, in spite of the obstacles which are always to be found.

Here we can mention the case of Agustina who has been selling 'chipa' (a typical Paraguayan bread) for several years.  She gets up very early in the morning to prepare her 'chipa' so that she can go out and sell it.  She sells her product as a street trader.  Her niece and husband help her with her sales.

Agustina would like to give special thanks to Fundación Paraguaya for the support which they have provided because it has enabled her to acquire more capital and thereby expand her business as she now has more 'chipa' sellers.  She has been able to use this capital to buy ingredients such as cheese, yucca starch, corn flour and firewood for preparing her 'chipas'.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making 'chipas' (bread), such as starch, cheese, milk, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice and beans

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more consignments of drugs

loans.name: Albertina Holanda

texts.es:
Albertina de 43 años, tiene un hijo de 4 años con su esposo que es obrero, ella tiene una pequeña farmacia en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil zona periurbana caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra.  

Escogió esta actividad económica porque por el sector donde vivía no había una farmacia y era muy difícil conseguir medicinas cuando se enfermaba su familia. Con un pequeño capital que tenía comenzó a comprar medicinas. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 15h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días vendiendo remedio como apronax, brocotocil, nemulabo etc. 
     
Con el préstamo quiere comprar medicinas como meloxicar, brocotocil, nemulabo expectorante etc. En el futuro quiere tener otra farmacia y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Albertina is 43 yeras old. She has a 4-year-old child with her husband, who is a laborer. She has a small pharmacy in the front part of her house. She lives in Fortín de Guayaquil, a peri-urban zone characterized by dirt roads.   

She chose this economic activity because there was no pharmacy in the area where she lived, and it was very difficult to get medicines when her family members got sick. With a small amount of capital she possessed, she began to buy medicines. Currently, she works from 3 p.m. to 8 p.m. every day selling medicines such as apronax, brocotocil, nemulabo, etc. 
     
With the loan, she wants to buy medicines such as meloxicar, brocotocil, nemulabo expectorant, etc. In the future, she would like to open another pharmacy and finish constructing her home.

loans.use: Buying medicines

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Lourdes Yaquelin

texts.es:
la sra. Lourdes Yaquelin E. O. tiene 44 años de edad y vive en la aldea Lazaro de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
Lourdes se dedica a la produccion y venta de pan casero como ser rosquillas, quesadilla y torta. su especialidad son las tortas de queso.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de sus sabrosos panes, tiene muchos clientes fijos todos los dias ya que su producto es de muy buena calidad, sabor e higiene.
las ganancias las necesita para sacar adelante a a su familia.
texts.en:
Lourdes Yaquelin E. O. is 44 years of age and lives in the Lazaro neighborhood of the city of San Lorenzo. 

Lourdes earns a living making and selling homemade pastries such as doughnuts, sweet cheese pound cake and cakes. Her specialty is the cheese cake.

She will use the loan to purchase ingredients for making her delicious pastries. She has many regular customers who visit every day since her product is of very high quality, flavor and hygiene. 

She needs the earnings to get her family ahead.

loans.use: To purchase corn, yeast, wheat flour, cheese, lard, margarine, eggs, soda and sugar

loans.name: El Gran Esfuerzo 4 Group

texts.es:
Rosa es una de los miembros del Grupo El Gran Esfuerzo, localizado en La ciudad de Hato Mayor, cuya economia depende de la agricultura y es una de las ciudades mas rurales de República Dominicana, en donde como muchas hay escasez de agua potable y de energía electrica y con una poblacion de dominicanos y emigrantes haitianos. Sus actividades principales son las ventas de ropas. Rosa es madre de 1 hijo, y viven junto a ella y su padre. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil son seguir trabajando duro para poder estar tranquila y descansar cuando cumpla mas años y tambien poder ayudar a sus hijos. Le encanta asistir a la Iglesia.

Rosa está muy emocionada de recibir su Decimo préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente su préstamos anteriores y asi haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 10 años, el cual inició con un pequeño ahorro, que guardaba para fines de negocio. Está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de diferentes modelos y estilos de ropa. Planea utilizar sus ganancias para comprar cosas que necesita y hacer mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is one of the members of 'El Gran Esfuerzo' (The Big Effort) group which is located in the town of Hato Mayor.  The town's economy depends on farming and it is one of the most rural towns in the Dominican Republic.  As in many other towns, there is a scarcity of drinking water and electricity and a population of Dominicans and emigrant Haitians.  The group's main business activity is selling clothes.

Rosa has one child and they live together with her father.  She tells us that her greatest challenges are to continue working hard so that she can be relaxed and rest when she is older, and also to help her children.  She loves going to church.

Rosa is very excited to be receiving her tenth loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having satisfactorily paid off her previous loans and thereby given a step forward in the growth of her business.  She has had her business for around 10 years.  She set up her business with a small amount of savings which she was keeping for business purposes.  She is planning to invest her new loan in buying different styles of clothes.  She plans to use her profits to buy things which she needs and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Marlene Julia

texts.es:
Marlene de 50 años, tiene dos hijos y su esposo que es ebanista. Tiene una ferretería en  una zona periurbana ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.

Antes de comenzar con la ferretería ella tenía una papelería pero como no tenía mucha demanda en el sector por donde vivía tuvo que cerrarla y comenzar otro negocio. Decidió tener una ferretería ya que lo que se vende no se daña y se puede tener los repuestos por mucho tiempo conservados. Ya tiene 4 años con su ferretería trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Vende pinturas, repuestos, aceites, tubos etc. 

Para surtir su ferretería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo pinturas, repuestos, tubos y así surtir mas su negocio. En el futuro quiere invertir dinero para tener otra ferretería con otra mercadería y seguir construyendo su casa.
texts.en:
Marlene is 50 years of age. She has two children and her husband who is a cabinetmaker. She has a hardware shop in an urbanized area located in the la Petimetral part of Guayaquil, a region surrounded by an estuary. 

Before starting up the hardware shop she had a paper supply store but as the demand was weak in the area where she lives she had to close it down and begin another business. She decided to have a hardware store since the items for sale are not easily damaged and parts may be kept in good condition for a very long time. She has had this shop for four years now and works from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day. She sells paint, oils, tubing, etc. 

In order to stock her hardware store she wants to use the loan to purchase paint, spare parts and tubing and thus supply her business better. In the future she wants to invest some money in another hardware shop with other merchandise and to keep building her house.

loans.use: To purchase paint, parts, tubing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El Sr. Angel es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, barrio San José, tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero.

      Desde muy joven empezó con el trabajo de curtiduría primeramente como ayudante de su padre, luego poco a poco fue juntando para su pequeño capital y así fue independizándose.

      Manifiesta que él mismo se encarga del proceso y luego de la venta de sus productos terminados como ser forros y vaquetas hacia las zonas de Itauguá y Asunción.

     Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cueros.
texts.en:
Angel is from the San José neighborhood of Carapeguá.  He is 31 years old and single.

When he was very young he began working in the tannery business.  He started out as his father's assistant then, little by little, he gathered together a small amount of capital and set up on his own.

He says that he himself is in charge of the processing and also the subsequent sale of his finished products such as coverings and leathers in the districts of Itauguá and Asunción.

He is requesting this loan to buy hides.

loans.use: To buy animal hides

loans.name: Luis Armando

texts.es:
el señor Luis Armando O. P. tiene de 51 años de edad,  es soltero y vive en el puerto de Amapala en donde vive con sus padres, Luis se dedica al corte de cabello este a sido su trabajo desde joven. 
su negocio esta ubicado en el barrio el Centro de San Lorenzo en donde viaja todo los dias de lunes a sabado desde su hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar materiales y herramientas para su barberia, desea proporcionar un mejor servicio a todos sus clientes. 
su sueño es que todo ponga normal en el pais ya que hay mucha escases de productos basicos y poco empleo.
texts.en: Luis Armando O. P. is 51-years-old. He's single and lives with his parents in Puerto de Amapala. Luis has been a barber since he was young. His business is located in the neighborhood of Centro de San Lorenzo. He travels there Monday-Saturday to work. He will use this loan to buy materials and tools for his barber shop. He wants to provide a better service to his customers. His dream is that everything normalizes in the country because right now there's a shortage of basic products and little employment.

loans.use: Purchase of shampoo, conditioner, shaving razors, electric hair clipper, scissors, grease, foam, towels, mirror

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more locks, cutlasses, nails, paint, hammers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more consignment of drugs

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Descripción:	
            El Sr. Armando M. es de la ciudad de Carapeguà, tiene 36 años, vive con su esposa actualmente y tiene 2 hijos menores.

	   Armando  es de profesión chapista con 10 años de antigüedad en el rubro, desde muy joven empezó a trabajar como secretario, debido a la falta de dinero para cursar una carrera, fue así que logro a ser un profesional y llegar a trabajar por cuenta propia. 

                Hoy en día cuenta con su propio taller y es reconocido en la misma ciudad como un profesional capaz y honesto.

	   Solicita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas, pinturas, masillas para sus trabajos en chapería y pinturas de los autos de sus clientes.
texts.en: Armando M. is from the city of Carapeguà. He's 36-years-old and lives with his wife and two young children. Armando is a metal worker specializing in auto body repair. He's worked in this field for 10 years. When he was very young he began working as a secretary, but due to the lack of money he couldn't finish a degree and that's how he became a metal worker and started a small business. These days he has his own repair shop and he's well-known in his city as a talented and honest professional. He's requesting this loan to buy tools, paint, and putty to work on his customers' cars.

loans.use: Purchase of tools, paint, and putty

loans.name: Yoli Jane

texts.es:
Yoli de 39 años, tiene tres hijos de 17, 8 y 4 años está separada de su esposo. Es comerciante informal de sabanas, toldos en una zona periurbana ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.

Empezó hace 7 años a ser comerciante porque le generaba buenos ingresos y también le daba tiempo para pasar con sus hijos. En la actualidad ella comprar sabanas, toldos y los vende a sus vecinos conocidos y potenciales clientes a crédito y al contado. El juego de sabanas las vende $ 38.00, los toldos a $ 45.00 (son cubiertas para camas y así evita que entren los insectos). Trabaja en horarios variados para poder ayudarles a sus hijos en los estudios. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar toldos, sabanas para tener variedad en los diseños. En el futuro quiere tener un local de la mercadería que vende y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en: Yoli is 39 years old. She has three children who are 17, 8, and 4-years-old and she's separated from her husband. She's an informal merchant and she sells sheets and mosquito nets in the outskirts of Guayaquil by the Perimetral, which is surrounded by a marsh. She began selling 7 years ago because she made good money and it let her spend time with her children. She currently buys sheets and mosquito nets and sells them to her friends and neighbors and occasionally gives credit to potential customers. She sells the sheet sets for $38 and the mosquito nets for $45. She works odd hours so that she can help her children with their schoolwork. With this loan she wants to buy mosquito nets and sheets in a variety of designs. In the future she wants to have a shop and to finish building her house.

loans.use: Purchase of sheets and mosquito nets

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca S.  tiene 36 años de edad está casada con el Sr. Aníbal Gómez  hace más 13 años  y vive en su casa propia en la  ciudad de Carapeguá, tienen 2 hijos en edad escolar.
        Desde jóven empezó a ayudar a su madre a confeccionar las colchas artesanales, de quién aprendió el oficio, también compra ropas en general para volver a venderlo, hoy en día  lleva a  vender sus productos en la zona de la capital del país con la ayuda de su marido, gracias a este trabajo logró construir una modesta casa y brindar buena atención a su hijo.  	

            Solicita el préstamo para la compra de sobrecamas, sábanas y hamaca.
texts.en:
Mrs Blanca S. is 36 years old and has been married to Mr Aníbal Gómez for more than 13 years.  She lives in her own home in the town of Carapeguá.  She and her husband have 2 school-age children.

When she was a young girl, Blanca started helping her mother to make hand-made bedspreads.  She learned the trade from her mother.  She also buys general bed linen to re-sell.  These days she takes her products to sell in the capital city with the help of her husband.  Thanks to this work she has managed to build a modest house and look after her children.

She is requesting this loan to buy bedspreads, sheets and hammocks.

loans.use: To buy bedspreads, sheets and hammocks

loans.name: Homero

texts.en:
Homero M., Jr. opened M. Gas and Tire two months ago because he wanted to be his own boss. He’s been doing this most of his life with his father, who owns convenience stores.

Homero originally went to Wells Fargo for his loan.  He said they referred him to ACCION Texas-Louisiana because they only lend to businesses that have been open for four years.  Homero says the loan will help a lot with inventory, so the store won’t look so empty.  If he does not get the loan he says “I probably would still be doing [business], but struggling a bit more.”

Homero has two sons. His wife works at a drug rehab center for children. Homero is proud of his business and he advises other business owners to “take it day by day.”

loans.use: To buy inventory for his store, primarily beer

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es:
El Sr. Cristhian es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 21 años, es soltero, hijo único y vive con su madre.

              Se dedica  a la venta de frazadas y colchas por la ciudad de La Colmena y sus compañías hace 3 años, su madre se dedica al mismo rubro.
 Cuenta con más de 60 clientes y comenta que tiene un buen ingreso ya que el mismo administra su negocio.
                Solicita el préstamo para la compra de colchas, frazadas.
texts.en:
Cristhian is from the town of Carapeguá.  He is 21 years old and single.  He is an only child and lives with his mother.

Cristhian has been selling blankets and bedspreads in the town of La Colmena and to his friends for three years.  His mother is in the same business.

He has more than 60 customers and he comments that he makes a good income since he runs his own business.

He is requesting his loan to buy bedspreads and blankets.

loans.use: To buy bedspreads, blankets, hammocks, quilts and other handicrafts

loans.name: Alida

texts.en:
For the past 10 years, Alida G. has wanted to open her own business. Now, she is finally starting a food booth. She plans to attend at least three fairs a month along the gulf. “Then, once I have enough money, I’ll open up a commissary in a stable location. The food booth is a way to get my foot in the door.” Her original plan was to “get a trailer and RV and just hit a new beach every Sunday, but the oil spill killed that plan.”
