She lives with her mother and sisters in the village of Tejedores in the Tambogrande agricultural district, a zone in the Piura province in the region with the same name a little more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.  
She works making and selling items of clothing.  She makes these clothes along with her sisters in a workshop located in their home.  The clothing that they make is sold in a nearby village and in the port of Paita (where her son works).  The business helps to pay her expenses and support the family.
Socorro would like to expand her business with the purchase of more materials to continue making clothing and increase her sales.  This is why she has found it convenient to request a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa that she plans to use to achieve her goal. 
She is a very calm and responsible woman.  Her main goal is to continue growing as an entrepreneur in order to gradually improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to expand business making and selling clothing items.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas D. Rio Blanco” ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento Puno, tiene 39 años D. edad,  D. estado civil casada, tiene tres hijos.  Solo pudo estudiar hasta tercero D. secundaria. 
Juliana está trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace seis años, el primer préstamo solicitado que fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, le sirvió para  incrementar el capital D. su negocio, actividad basada en la venta D. cereales, lo cual es realizado en Arequipa. 
La señora  solicitará un nuevo crédito D.  S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar cereales al por mayor.
Su sueño es progresar y seguir adelante en su negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es conversar con las demás socias.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the “Brisas D. Rio Blanca” (White River Breezes) Communal Bank.  It is located in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno department.  She is 39 years old, married, and has three children.  She was only able to go to school up to the third year of high school.

Juliana has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six years.  The first loan she requested was for 300 soles.  She used the loan to increase the capital in her business, which is selling grains in Arequipa.

Her dream is to progress and get ahead in her business.

What she likes about her communal bank is talking with the other members.

loans.use: To buy grains wholesale

loans.name: Nelia América

texts.es:
Nelia tiene 54 años de edad, es viuda y vive junto a su hija en el caserío Tejedores del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona que se encuentra ubicada a mas de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, este se encuentra ubicado frente al colegio y la posta médica del lugar, lo que genera que siempre tenga clientes ya que el lugar es bastante transitado, ella atiende a sus clientes con amabilidad y trata de tener en stock diversos productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda que posee.

Nelia desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos de modo que pueda seguir satisfaciendo la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante y que gusta mucho de sentirse activa y útil. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
Nelia, age 54, is a widow.  She lives with her daughter in the Tejedores settlement in the agricultural community of Tambogrande.  This zone is located over four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells basic needs products and groceries in a grocery store in her house.  It is located in front of the school and the local medical clinic.  She always has customers because the location is well traveled.  She waits on her customers amiably, and she tries to have a stock of diverse products.  That way she is able to satisfy the customer demand that she has. 

Nelia wishes to expand her business by getting more products.  That way she will be able to satisfy her customers’ demand.  That is why she believes it is advisable to request a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  

She is a woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She really likes to feel active and useful.  The people that know her hold her in high esteem and respect her.

loans.use: To buy basic needs items and groceries to expand her business

loans.name: María Agustina

texts.es:
María Agustina tiene 33 años de edad, es separada y reside junto a  sus tres hijos en el sector Froilán Alemana del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, perteneciente a la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida. Ella prepara diariamente diversos platos de comida y los ofrece en venta al publico en general en el mercado del distrito. El negocio es su principal fuente de ingreso y debido al tiempo que lleva en la actividad y a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus alimentos, actualmente cuenta con una clientela estable y fidelizada.

María desea adquirir insumos para poder ampliar su producción y percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles. Ella es una persona luchadora y bastante responsable. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijas una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Agustina is 33 years old and separated.  She lives with her three children in the Froilán Alemana sector in the agricultural district of Tambogrande.  This zone is in the Piura province, which belongs to the region of the same name.  It is over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She makes and sells food.  She prepares different dishes every day.  She sells to the general public at the district market.  The business is her primary source of income because of the time this activity takes and the good seasoning with which she prepares her food.  She currently has stable and loyal customers.

María wants to get ingredients to be able to increase her production and get greater income from her sales.  That is why she believes it advisable to request a loan for 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

She is a tenacious and very responsible person.  Her great desire is to give her daughters a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to increase her food production and sales

loans.name: Sulma

texts.es: Sulma tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de animales, pero para adquirir los animales, son comprados a un menor precio, y durante 4 meses procura darles la alimentación balanceada para que estén gordos y tengan el peso exacto. Ella se considera una excelente vendedora, su facilidad de palabra y capacidad de convencer logra tener buenos acuerdos, obteniendo ganancias considerables y recuperando lo invertido. Su mayor prioridad es dar el sustento a su familia, y que sus hijos completen sus estudios. Con el tiempo su capital de trabajo se ha incrementando y eso la mantiene tranquila y satisfecha, ahora espera intensificarse en esta actividad y aumentar el número de reses que tiene. Es su crédito numero 13 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de una vaca.
texts.en: Sulma is 51 years old. She lives with her husband and 5 children in her own home. For six years she has been selling animals. To acquire the animals, she buys them at a lower price and for four months tries to give them balanced feed so they will be fattened up and have the right weight.  She considers herself an excellent saleswoman. Her facility of speech and capacity to persuade has resulted in good agreements, obtaining considerable earnings and recouping her investment. Her biggest priority is supporting her family and for her children to complete their studies. Over time, her working capital has increased and this keeps her calm and satisfied. Now she hopes to intensify this activity and increase the number of cattle she has. This is her 13th loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support and she likes being a part of a communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people. She is grateful to all of the people who are making the loan since it will be very useful for her business' progress. With the loan she has asked for, she will invest in buying a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Salvador”, ubicado en el distrito D. Capachica, provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, tiene 57 años D. edad.  Está casada y tiene seis hijos. No pudo concluir sus estudios, estudió la primaria pero no puso terminarla.
La señora tiene una plastiqueria donD. venD. todo tipo D. productos plásticos, paralelamente se dedica a la venta D. artesanía. Ella  está trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace diez años, el primer préstamo solicitado que fue D. S/.300. 00 nuevo soles, lo utilizó para ampliar la mercadería D. su negocio.
Con éste crédito D. S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles,  comprará más productos plásticos al por mayor.-
Su sueño  es conseguir más capital y tener una ferretería bien equipada.
Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el préstamo D. la cta. Interna y las ganancias D. los ahorros.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the “San Salvador” (Holy Savior) Communal Bank, located in the Capachica district, in the province and department of Puno.  She is 57 years old, married, and has 6 children.  Julia started but couldn't complete her primary education.

Julia has a plastics shop where she sells all types of plastic products.  At the same time, she sells artisan goods.  Julia has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 10 years now.  The 1st loan she requested was for 300 new sols, and was used to expand her business's merchandise.

With this loan of 2,000 new sols, Julia will buy more plastic products at wholesale.  Her dream is to acquire more capital and to have a well-supplied hardware store.

What she likes most about her communal bank are the loans she receives and the earnings on her savings.

loans.use: TO BUY ARTICLES OF PLASTIC AT WHOLESALE TO SELL IN  HER STORE

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus - Chupaca Group

texts.es:
Antonia, viuda, con 3 hijos a su cargo. ElL. es presidenta D. L. Alcancia Comunal "Divino Niño Jesus". Antonia se dedica a L. venta D. medicamentos. Se iniciò con muy poco capital y su negocio se ubica en L. plaza principal D. Chupaca en Huancayo; en sus inicios este negocio fue un Bazar, gracias a èste trabajo logrò terminar sus estudios superiores D. educaciòn. Posteriormente y gracias a sus hermanos quienes estudiaron Farmacia logrò implementar lo que es hasta hoy su Botica "El AguiL.".
Antonia quedò vuida hace 25 años, y se hizo cargo D. sus hijos, quienes por el esfuerzo D. su madre ahora son jovenes con estudios profesionales. El anhelo D. Antonia es que su negocio siga creciendo para poder apoyar a sus hijos con sus maestrìas.
(en L. foto, Antonia es L. cuarta persona D. L. izquierda, señora D. pelo color plateado con lentes, viste chompa color rosa y se encuentra detras del mostrador D. su negocio)
El dinero que se le brinda, lo usarà para comprar mercaderìa para su Botica.
texts.en:
Antonia is a widow with 3 children in her care. She is the president of the "Divino Niño Jesus" ("Divine Child Jesus") loan group. Antonia sells medicines. She started with very little capital and her business is located in the main square of Chupaca in Huancayo. In the beginning her business was a bazaar. Thanks to her work she was able to complete her college education. Later, thanks to her brothers, who studied pharmacy, she was able to set up what has been until today her pharmacy "El AguiL." ("The Eagle").

Antonia became a widow 25 years ago and took charge of her children. Thanks to her efforts they are now young professionals. Antonia´s wish is for her business to continue to grow so as to be able to support her children through their master's degrees. 

(In the picture Antonia is the fourth person from the left - the silver-haired lady with glasses, wearing a pink sweater and standing behind the counter of her shop). 

She is going to use the money lent to her to buy merchandise for her pharmacy.

loans.use: Increase merchandise stock for pharmacy.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.en:
Rosaura is a 49-year-old mother of four who lives with her family in Siquirres, Limón, located near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. The loan consultant who has been working with Rosaura describes her as a hard working, busy entrepreneur who fills her time with a variety of activities. 

An experienced businesswoman, this will be Rosaura´s 6th loan with Fundación Mujer. Rosaura has been successful in combining her business instincts and diligent work ethic in order to take advantage of past loans and make improvements to her business.

Rosaura runs a sewing business, where she produces various types of clothing for men, women and children such as bags, pajamas,socks and shirts. She is applying for the current loan as a method to increase her working capital in order to satisfy the demands of her clients. With this loan, Rosaura plans to invest in a new sewing machine, fabric, threads, needles, and other sewing materials. 

On a typical day, Rosaura wakes up early and takes care of household chores. After cooking and cleaning, she dedicates her time to the activities of her business: making sales, sewing clothes, collecting on repayments, making purchases, etc.  At the moment, Rosaura runs her business from her home. In the future, her goal is to open a central location in order to offer her sewing products to clients.

loans.use: For the purchase of a sewing machine and sewing materials.

loans.name: Mario Anderson

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr.Mario ; el tiene 56 años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 hijos; el socio es guía de turismo ya hace años que trabaja en turismo , el socio vende paquetes turísticos a Machupicchu,Valle Sagrado, City tours entre otros tours mas.

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar los boletos turísticos para estos tours y para pagar a sus proveedores.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA” [MUSTARD SEED]. This bank is located in the district of Cuzco, which belongs to the province and department of Cuzco. 

The member is Mario. He is 56 years old, married and has 4 children. He is a tourist guide and has worked in tourism for years. He sells tourism packages to Machupicchu,Valle Sagrado, and city tours among others.  

He is asking for the loan to buy tourism tickets for these tours and to pay his suppliers. 

He is grateful to those who are a part of this dream and is committed to making his payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy tourism tickets for these tours and to pay his suppliers.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Bartolina Sisa”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de EL Collao, Departamento de Puno, tiene 37 años de edad,  está casada y tiene tres hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria completa.
Julia está trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, el primer préstamo solicitado que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, le permitió  incrementar  el capital  de su negocio, ella se dedicaba a la venta de semillas, actualmente se dedica al engorde de ganados, principalmente toros. 
La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que le servirá para incrementar su capital.
Su sueño  es crecer en su negocio.
Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es el ahorro que genera ganancia.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the community bank “Bartolina Sisa”, located in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, Department of Puno. She is 37 years old, married and has three children. She completed her high school education.
Julia has been working with “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” for 5 years; the first loan she requested was for S/. 300 Nuevos Soles; this loan allowed her to increase her working capital. She used to sell seeds but she now fattens cattle, mainly bulls.
Mrs. Julia will request a new loan for S/. 2000 Nuevos Soles which she will use to increase her capital. Her dream is to grow her business. What she likes about the community bank is that the savings generate profits.

loans.use: Capital to nuy more cattle

loans.name: Copo De Nieve Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal de Copo de Nieve está iniciando su segundo ciclo en el centro focal de Germán Busch. Esta banca comunal cuenta con la participación de nueve integrantes, las mismas que desembolsaran por segunda vez. Han renovado la mesa directiva y para este ciclo tiene como presidenta a la señora Claudia, como tesorera Vicente y como secretaria de actas a la señora Adriana. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, tienda de abarrotes, confección de ropa deportiva, contratista en confección, fabricación de alfombras, venta de carnes, venta de grutas, comerciante y venta de papa y chuño.
La señora presidenta es una mujer joven con bastante experiencia, ella comenta que antes estuvo en otro centro focal por 6 años  y que cambió de centro focal, porque cambio de domicilio.  Entusiasmada también comenta que fue ella quién formó este nuevo grupo, el mismo que hasta la fecha ha trabajado sin tropiezos. 
Con respecto a l negocio de la señora presidenta, ella costura ropa deportiva, aprendió de su mamá hace muchos años atrás. Ella compra los insumos para la elaboración de los deportivos de la Feria 16 de Julio y realiza sus ventas en las provincias aledañas a la ciudad de El Alto.
Lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer es la oportunidad de reunirse con sus compañeras y olvidarse de las preocupaciones.
texts.en:
The Copo de Nieve village bank is beginning its second cycle in the German Busch center.  The village bank has 9 members who were all involved in the first cycle as well.  They have reunited the board and, for this cycle, Claudia is the president of the board, Vicente is the treasurer, and Adriana is the secretary.  Each of the women run different business such as selling food, grocery stores, making athletic wear, candy, rugs, selling meat, grutas, potatoes and potato flour.

The group president is a young woman with a lot of experience; she worked in another area for 6 years but moved her business to this shopping center when she moved. She formed this group of borrowers with a great degree of enthusiasm and to date, they have worked well together without any problems.  

The group president runs a business sewing athletic clothing; she learned the trade from her mother many years ago.  She buys the materials for the clothing in the 16 de Julio market and she sells the clothes in the small towns around the city of El Alto.  What she most likes about Pro Mujer is the opportunity to get together with her bank partners and forget her worries.

loans.use: Purchase an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Evelin Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Evelin ; ella tiene 50 años de edad ,casada  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de turismo ella vende paquetes turísticos a Machupicchu , Valle Sagrado, entre otros mas,conjuntamente con su esposo ambos trabajan y asi mantienen a su familia . 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar boletos turísticos y para pagar a sus proveedores.

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Evelin belongs to the "Grain of Mustard" village bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district of Cusco, Peru.

Evelin is 50 years old, married with 4 children.  She balances her household duties with her tourism business where she sells tourist packages to Machupicchu, the Sacred Valley, and other places.  She works with her husband and together they support the family.

She is seeking the loan to buy tourist tickets and to pay her suppliers.

She is grateful to those who are part of this dream and she promises to pay back the debt on time.

loans.use: Purchase tourist tickets and to pay her suppliers

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.en:
Diana is a 29-year-old mother of two who lives with her partner and children in the city of Limón, one of the poorest and most violent cities in Costa Rica, on the Caribbean coast. The loan consultant who has been working with Diana describes her as a humble and hardworking entrepreneur with aspirations to provide a better life for her family. A dedicated mother and entrepreneur, this will be Diana´s 3rd loan with Fundación Mujer. Diana is serious when it comes to her business because it represents a significant amount of the family's income.
 
Diana earns a living by offering laundry services to clients, including local primary schools, high schools, and various members of the community. Diana´s laundromat is located in a central location which is good for business. Diana can rely on the assistance of her mother during busy periods, or when Diana has to go out and run errands. 

In addition to laundry services, Diana also sells clothing from door to door in her community, although this loan will be used as working capital for her laundry business. Specifically, Diana would like to invest in a new washing machine and ironing equipment. 

Diana´s goal is to increase revenues from the laundromat. She wants to expand her business and attract new clients. Her main difficulty is earning enough income during down times; for example, when school is not in session.

loans.use: For the purchase of a washing machine and ironing equipment.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Maria ; ella tiene 49 años de edad ,separa y tiene 2 hijos; La socia tiene su negocio de movilidad escolar conjuntamente trabaja con su esposo siendo esta la actividad que ambos realizan y sacan a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar un scaner para su computadora y también para comprar algunos accesorios para el carro. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the Grain of Mustard village bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, of Cusco, Peru.

She is 49 years old, separated from her husband and has 2 children.  She runs a business providing transportation to students with her husband.  Together they support their family and help to carry them forward.

She is seeking a loan to buy a scanner for her computer and to buy some accessories for her car.

She is grateful to those who are helping her to achieve this dream and she promises to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase a scanner for her computer and to buy some accessories for her car

loans.name: Franz

texts.es: Franz tiene 20 años, vive con su madre en una casa alquilada. Desde que era niño conoció el arte del mate burilado, veía como lo elaboraban, desde entonces se convirtió en un experto en la elaboración de estos objetos artesanales. Hoy diseña diversos diseños, que son vendidos a los grandes comerciantes de artesanías de su ciudad y de otras ciudades. Su taller de trabajo esta instalado en el interior de su casa, que junto a su madre realizan esta actividad. Este negocio es rentable y ventajoso para Franz porque le permite disponer de su tiempo y estudiar, por ello desea tener un taller más grande, donde pueda contratar mano de obra para seguir elaborando estos mates burilados. Es el crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de calabazas que es el insumo principal para elaborar mates burilados.
texts.en: Franz is 20 years old and lives with his mother in a rented home.  Since he was a child, he has known the art of making decorative bowls (mate burilado); he observed how they were made and then became an expert in making these handicrafts himself.  Today, he makes various designs and sells them in the artisanal centers of the city and other cities.  His workshop is inside his home and he performs his craft with his mother.  Their business is profitable and advantageous for Franz because it gives him free time to study.  He would like to have a larger workshop where he can contract other workers to keep making his art.  This is his second loan through MFP and he is happy to know that he has financial support; he is also grateful to be part of the village bank because the other members of the bank are very responsible people.  He is grateful to all the people who will provide him this loan as it will help him to grow his business.  With the loan, he will invest in buying pumpkin/gourds which are the primary ingredient for his craft.

loans.use: Buy pumpkins to make decorative bowls and handicrafts

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE ARENA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lisbeth; ella tiene 41 años de edad, casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de accesorios de maquinarias pesadas como (tractor),conjuntamente con su esposo ambos se dedican a este negocio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mas accesorios para su negocio. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is a member of the Grain of Sand village bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district of Cusco, Peru.

Lisbeth is 41 years old, married with one child.  She works buying and selling accessories for heavy machinery like tractors; she works with her husband in this line of work.

She is seeking a loan to buy more accessories for her business.

She is grateful to those who will provide her this loan and help her; she promises to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase accessories for her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La Señora Victoria P. se dedica a la produccion de leche cruda, vive en la zona de la Maica zona agricola que se encuentra en la periferie de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños. De 7 y 12 años.

Cuenta con 6 cabezas de ganado lechero, vacas a las que cuida todos los dias, ambos esposos se levantan de madrugada para todas sus actividades de produccion de leche, desde el cortar pasto, cortar alfa, llevar a comer a sus vacas, ordeñar la leche de las vacas, llevar esa leche a los tanques de frio de donde recoge la planta industrializadora de leche, luego deben tambien encargarse del cuidado de sus hijos, y por la tarde volver a realizar las mismas activiades porque las vacas producen leche 2 veces al dia 

La señora Victoria P. solicitoel credito para la compra de soya alimento para las vacas, aprovechando que puede coprar ahora antes de que en los proximos meses escasee o no vendan en los mercados.

La señora Victoria P. desea con el tiempo mejorar sus condiciones de vida para que sus hijos vean en ella un ejemplo y sean trabajadores y responsables.
texts.en:
Mrs. Victoria P. produces raw milk; she lives in the area of La Maica, an agricultural zone located in the periphery of the city of Cochabamba. She is married and has two young children (7 and 12 years old).

She has 6 heads of dairy cattle which she cares for every day; both spouses get up at dawn for all the activities required to produce milk, from cutting grass, cutting alfalfa, taking their cows to eat, milking the cows, taking the milk to the refrigerated tanks where it get picked up by the plant that industrializes the milk. Soon after, they also have to take care of their children; in the afternoon, they perform all the same activities again because the cows produce milk twice a day.

Mrs. Victoria requested the loan to buy soy (cattle feed); she wants to take advantage of buying it now before it becomes scarce in the coming months or it is not sold at all at the markets.

With time, Mrs. Victoria P. wishes to improve her quality of life so their children can see in her a role model, and they become hard-working and responsible.

loans.use: Buy soy as cattle feed

loans.name: Evelyn Gabriela

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 22-year-old mother who lives with her family in Limón, located in the Caribbean region of Costa Rica. The loan consultant who has been working with Evelyn has described her as a hardworking entrepreneur with a pleasant disposition. She has been working in her sales business over the past two years with the assistance of her aunt, and has observed that making sales to members of her community is an effective way to earn an income without neglecting her family responsibilities, because she can set her own work schedule. Evelyn also consults her husband before making serious business decisions. This will be her 1st loan with Fundación Mujer. 

Evelyn has a business of selling women´s clothing. The majority of her clients are friends, acquaintances and neighbors who live in her community. Her general routine is to wake up early and take care of domestic tasks such as cooking and cleaning. When the first part of her work day is complete, she gets ready to head out into the community, dedicated to the activities of her business, such as making sales, collecting payments or purchasing merchandise. When she is out, she relies on her mother to take care of her baby. 

Evelyn has the goal of earning enough income from her sales activity that she would be able to open a store or central location from which to sell items. Her main obstacle is a lack of the working capital necessary for making investments in clothing merchandise. Evelyn hopes to use this loan to purchase various women´s clothing items such as sports clothes and casual wear.

loans.use: To purchase women´s clothing for resale

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO"; la socia vive en la comunidad campesina D. Pongobamba distrito D. Chinchero y provincia D. Urubamba, departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Agustina; ella tiene 59 años D. edad ella es V. y tiene 2 hijos;  la socia se dedica a la agricultura como principal fuente D. ingreso económico, la socia trabaja en sus tierras junto a sus hijos ellos solicitan ayuda D. la comunidad porque actualmente como era en el tiempo D. los inkas existía el famoso AYNI (ayuda al projimo en sus tierras para sembrar y cosechar); la socia siembra papa y maíz luego ella venD. estos productos y es así como se mantiene y ayuda en los estudios a sus hijos, la socia no tuvo la suerte D. estudiar ni la secundaria y desD. muy niña se puso a trabajar en las tierras D. sus padres, hoy ella comprenD. que el estudio es muy importante ahora para que ellos tengan mejor oportunidad en la vida. La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra D. maíz y pap para sembrar en sus tierras para cosechar el año entrante.

Los otros socios se dedican ala agricultura y a la crianza D. animales menores.

La socia agradece el préstamo que se le otorgará y se compromete a seguir trabajando con mucho ahincó para cumplir con los pagos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Agustina belongs to the “Virgen del Rosario” (Virgin of the Rosary) community bank.  She lives in the rural community of Pongobamba, in Chinchero district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Agustina is 59 years old.  She is a widow and has two children.  Her main source of income is farming.  She works on her land together with her sons.  They ask for help from their community because currently, as was the case in the time of the Inca,  there exists the famous AYNI system (a form of communal work where neighbors help each other on their lands at sowing and harvest time).  Agustina grows potatoes and corn which she then sells.  This is how she supports herself and helps her children with their studies.  Agustina herself wasn't lucky enough to study at secondary level and she started working on her parents' land when she was a very little girl.  Today she understands that studying is very important if her children are to have a better opportunity in life.  She is requesting a loan to invest in buying corn and potatoes to sow on her lands and harvest next year.

The other members of the group also farm and raise young animals.

Agustina is grateful for the loan which she will receive and pledges to continue working hard to make her repayments and improve her business.

loans.use: To invest in buying corn and potatoes to sow on her lands and harvest next year

loans.name: Nancy Nohemi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SACSAYHUAMAN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy; La socia tiene 32 años de edad, la socia es soltera y tiene 1 hijos, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de artesanía y pinturas ella vende réplicas de pinturas de la escuela cusqueña, ella tiene todos los arcángeles, santos costumbristas, imágenes católicas de vírgenes y santos en todo tamaño y son muy solicitadas; la socia también vende artesanía como son adornos en arcilla, ceniceros, llaveros, huacos retratos. La socia desea incrementar sus ventas y para ello ella desea el crédito. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la venta.

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group member is part of the Sacsayhuaman group. The communal bank is located in the Huanchac district, which is part of Cusco province in the department of Cusco. 

Nancy, the group member, is 32 years old, single and has one child. She makes a living buying and selling artisan goods and paintings. She sells replicas of paintings from the Cusqueñan School, has paintings of archangels, traditional saints, images in all sizes of Catholic virgins and saints. These are in high demand. 

The group member also sells artisan clay decorations, ashtrays, key rings, and pottery. The group member wants to increase her sales and for this reason she is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise for these sales. 

The group members thanks you for and appreciates the loan granted to her by these means, and she likewise promises to re-pay the loan in the established increments.

loans.use: The group member asks for the loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr.Vidal ; el tiene 40 años de edad ,soltero;el socio se dedica a la compra de maquinas de construcción para luego alquilarlo a las obras que lo soliciten a la vez el socio trabaja en una institución privada. 

El socio solicita el préstamo para hacer el mantenimiento de las maquinas de construcción  y para algunos gastos personales.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Vidal belongs to the “Granito de Mostaza” (Mustard Seed) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Vidal is 40 years old and single.  He buys construction machinery which he then hires out to building projects which need them.  He also works in a private institution.

He is requesting a loan to cover maintenance work on the construction machinery and for some personal expenses.

He is grateful to those who will take part in his dream by funding his loan and pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To have maintenance work done on his construction machinery and for some personal expenses

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jorge Antonio; el tiene 52 años de edad y es casado y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de servicio de taxi, el socio tiene un carro donde realiza servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad del Cusco, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de taxi. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos y mantenimiento para el carro productos.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Progreso" ["Progress"] communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is also in the province and department of Cusco.

The borrower's name is Mr. Jorge Antonio.  He is 52 years old, married, and has one son.  Jorge alternates his daily activities with a taxi service business.  He has a car that he uses to provide taxi service throughout the different streets of the city of Cusco.  He would like to improve his taxi service.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy spare parts and maintenance products for his car.

Jorge is grateful to those who, through this means, will contribute to his dream.  He also promises to comply with his repayment schedule according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintenance products for his taxi

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “SACSAYHUAMAN ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elba; La socia tiene 55 años de edad, la socia es casada  y tiene 8 hijos, la socia se dedica a la artesanía, ella trabaja con artesanía desde hace 25 años, la socia tiene su pequeño stand y vende todo tipo de arte, desde llaveros, adornos de cerámica, ceniceros, vasos, porta lapiceros, lapiceros con motivos de cholitas, títeres andinos y ella también elabora muñecas de trapo con trajes típicos de la zona andina.  La socia desea invertir en la compra de mercadería de tipo artesanal, ella tiene sus proveedores y también comprará chalinas hechas en oveja y lana de alpaca bebe. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería.

La socia  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elba belongs to the “Sacsayhuaman” Communal Bank, located in the district of Huanchac, department and province of Cusco.

Elba is 55 years old, married, and has 8 children.  She has been an artisan for some 25 years and she has a little stand where she sells all types of art, including key rings, ceramic decorations, ash trays, glasses, pencil holders, mechanical pencils with peasant decorations, Andean puppets, and she makes rag dolls with typical Andean clothing.

Elba wishes to invest in buying merchandise of the artisan type.  She has her own suppliers and, also, she wants to buy scarves made from the wool of sheep and baby alpacas.

Elba appreciates and values the loans available through this medium and, at the same time, she promises to comply with her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: TO BUY ARTISAN MERCHANDISE FOR HER STAND

loans.name: Marcial Jesus

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Marcial; el tiene 45 años de edad, soltero; el socio trabaja en el sector  público, y a la vez quiere invertir en un negocio de venta de mercadería referente a la navidad, como adornos,juguetes,entre otros mas es por eso que el viajo a Lima a cotizar todo esto.
 
El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar artículos navideños para poder ofrecer a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos.

 El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marcial Jesus belongs to the "Granito de Mostaza" ["Mustard Seed"] communal bank.  This communal bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is also in the province and department of Cusco.

Mr. Marcial is 45 years old, single, and works in the public sector.  At this time, he would like to invest in a business selling Christmas merchandise like ornaments, toys, and other items. Furthermore, he traveled to Lima in order to get a quote on all these things.

He is requesting this loan to buy Christmas items that he will offer for sale to his friends, relatives, and neighbors.

Marcial is grateful to those who, through this means, will contribute to his dream. He also promises to comply with his repayment schedule according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy Christmas items to sell to his friends, relatives, and neighbors

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes” ubicado en el distrito,  provincia de Azángaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil  soltera y tiene 01 hijo, realizó estudios de educación superior incompleta.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 04 años, su préstamo inicial  fue S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de comidas y panadería.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  invertirá para comprar insumos para su negocio.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener un restaurante y vender ropas.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la solidaridad.
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the “Azangarinas Valientes” ["Courageous Women of Azángaro"] Communal Bank, located in the district and province of Azángaro, department of Puno.  She is 38 years old, single, and has one son.  She partially completed her higher education.

She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years.  Her first loan was for S/. 500 nuevos soles, which she used to increase capital for her business of selling food and baking bread.

Lucila is requesting a new loan of S/. 2,500 nuevos soles, which she will invest in ingredients for her business.

Her dream for the future is to have a restaurant and to sell clothing.

Her favorite things about her communal bank are the punctuality and solidarity.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing foods

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas D. Rio Blanco” ubicado en el distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 52 años D. edad, D. estado civil viuda y con 6 hijos, tiene grado D. instrucción D. educación primaria completa.
La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace cinco años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital D. su negocio D. engorD. D. ganado vacuno, actualmente tiene un negocio D. compra y venta D. autos la cual es compartida con su hijo.
Luisa solicitara un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá incrementar el capital D. su negocio.
Su sueño es  seguir adelante con su negocio y tener más capital. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the "Brisas D. Rio Blanco" ["Breezes of the White River"] Communal Bank, which is located in the district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, department of Puno.  She is 52 years old, widowed, and has 6 children.  She completed primary school.

Luisa has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.  The first loan she requested was for 500 nuevos soles, which she used to increase capital for her cattle fattening business.  Currently, she has a business that she shares with her son, buying and selling cars.

Luisa is requesting a new loan of 3,000 nuevos soles.  This money will allow her to increase her business' capital.

Her dream is to get ahead with her business and to have more capital.  She enjoys the punctuality of her communal bank.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando is thirty-one years old.  He lives in the village of Muy Finca in the district of Morrope, which is northeast of the major city of Chiclayo.  It is a rural region primarily populated by small farmers and families that raise animals.  Orlando shares his home with his wife and their two dependent children.

For more than ten years, Orlando has been in the business of raising animals.  He has significant experience with a variety of domesticated animals and is skilled at raising them in a sustainable and healthy manner.  Orlando sells his animals in local markets once they reach the appropriate size.

The requested loan will be used to purchase roofing for his home.  He finds that the current state of his roof is inappropriate for his family's continued health and, therefore, plans to make this one-time purchase to improve his family’s quality of life.  He expects that the added protection from the elements will improve their health and reduce their stress level.  He hopes that will improve their productivity, happiness and reduce health expenses.

loans.use: To purchase roofing for his home

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol” ubicado en el distrito de Paucarcolla, provincia de Puno, departamento Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene cuatro hijos, con grado de instrucción de educación primaria completa.
Luisa viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace siete años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles,  el cual le sirvió para  comprar  insumos para elaborar pan, negocio de aquella temporada. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de golosinas y gaseosas.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar la mercadería de su negocio.
Su sueño es  seguir adelante con su negocio y surtir su pequeña tienda con nuevos productos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es el plazo de trabajo, responsabilidad, compartir la alegría y otros.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the “Santiago Apóstol” Communal Bank, located in the district of Paucarcolla, in the province of Puno, in the department of Puno. She is 32 years old, married and has four children. She has completed primary school.
Luisa has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 7 years. The first loan she sought was for 300 New Peruvian Soles that she used to buy materials to make bread, which was her business then. Currently she sells soda and candy.
She is now requesting a new loan of 500 New Peruvian Soles, which will allow her to increase her business merchandise.
Her dream is to carry her business forwards and stock her little store with new products.
What she likes about the Communal Bank are the deadlines, responsibility, sharing happiness etc.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise

La señora es una socia nueva que recientemente trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela  Ramos con un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizara para incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de animales caseros.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener más capital y poner una tienda de ropas.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the “Azangarinas Valientes” community bank which is located in Azángaro district, Azángaro province, Puno Department.  She is 32 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 3 children.  She completed her secondary education.

Luz Marina is a new member who has recently begun working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  She will use her loan for 500 nuevos soles to increase the working capital of her business selling domestic animals.

Her dream for the future is to have more capital and to set up a clothes shop.

What she most likes about her community bank are the meetings.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

Margarita is currently requesting a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles which will allow her to increase her business capital.

Her dream is to have her own butcher's shop.

What she most likes about her community bank is all the activities which take place in the meetings.

loans.name: Margarita

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila T. is from the village of Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 60 years old. Priscila is married and has 11 adult-aged children. To make a living, Priscila owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Priscila has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Priscila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Priscila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Priscila is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Priscila from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Mrs. Patricia Q. is from the Barangay of Migpangi, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married to Antonio Q., and blessed with 4 children, 3 of whom are school-aged and one who is already married. To make a living, she is presently engaged in a crab-dealing business. She is also receiving support from her husband, who is a fisherman. She’s been engaged in the crab-dealing business for 15 years. Together with her husband, she is earning at least 3,500 PHP. 

Just this year, Patricia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Patricia, as a newly recognized member of PMPC under the Regular Loan Program, is requesting 5,000 PHP as her first loan, which will be used for additional capital for her existing crab-dealing business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, her children’s education and possible business expansions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital in her crab-dealing business

Every month, Y. has to spend 60 USD on food, 15 USD on electricity and water supplies, and 65 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Y. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. In the future, Y. would like to be able to repair her house.

loans.name: Frelly's Group

texts.en:
Frelly S. is from the village of Cutog GranD., Reina Mercedes, in Isabela Province. She is 38 years old. Frelly is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Frelly is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, she owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Frelly joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This will be Frelly’s 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisher-folk, and small-business entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Oscar Fabian

texts.es:
Oscar de 27 años, tiene un hijo con su esposa y se apoyan mutuamente trabajando en su panadería, viven en una zona periurbana llamada perimetral está rodeada de un estero salado. 

Hace 5 años se caso y tuvo que conseguir un ingreso económico para poder mantener a su familia, poco a poco con experiencia y haciendo pan pudo comprar maquinas y hornos para ampliar su negocio.  En la actualidad semanalmente compra materia prima como harina, mantequilla, huevos para hacer los panes y dulces para su panadería. Trabaja desde las 04h30m haciendo panes hasta que habré el negocio y lo atiende hasta las 18h00pm.
 
Con el préstamo quiere comprar una máquina para hacer panes y un horno para hacer con un mayor volumen. En el futuro quiere tener un local mas grande para su panadería y darle una mejor vida a familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 27 years old.  He has a child with his wife and they support each other working in their bakery.  They live in a peri-urban area called Perimetral which is surrounded by a salt marsh.

Five years ago Oscar got married and had to get himself an income to support his family.  Little by little, with experience and by making bread, he managed to buy machines and ovens to expand his business.  Currently he buys raw materials such as flour, butter and eggs weekly to make bread and sweet pastries for his bakery.  He works from 4.30am baking bread and serves until 6.00pm.

He will use his loan to buy a bread-making machine and an oven so that he can a larger volume of bread.  In the future, he would like to have larger premises for his bakery and provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: To buy a bread-making machine

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 53 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el sector El Cardo una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Olmos, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, ella cría animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive, adicionalmente cuenta con una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado para brindar transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la que brinda servicio de transporte en las zonas aledañas.

María desea adquirir mas animales y alimentos balanceados para ampliar su negocio de venta por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante tranquila y responsable, con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar, las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien confiable.
texts.en:
María is a 53 year old mother. She lives with her family in the El Cardo sector, a rural area in the agricultural district of Olmos located in Lambayeque province, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

For two years, she has worked at raising and selling small animals. She raises them in the rear of her home. When they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to merchants who always visit the area in which she lives. In addition, she has a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle used for providing transport to cargo and passengers) with which she offers transportation services in adjacent areas.

María wishes to acquire more animals and balanced feed in order to enlarge her animal sales business. That’s why she considers it advisable to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 new soles which will help her achieve her objective. She is a rather quiet and responsible woman with a great desire to make progress. People that know her consider her trustworthy.

loans.use: The purchase of animals and feed in order to enlarge her business of raising and selling animals.

loans.name: Deolanda

texts.es:
Deolanda es una madre D. familia D. 63 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su familia en el caserío Boca Chica del distrito agrícola D. Olmos, una zona ubicada en la provincia D. Lambayeque, a más D. dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace cinco años a la comercialización y venta D. productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos D. uso diario D. buena calidad y con una buena atención. Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija que siempre acuD. a su negocio a consumir los productos que ofrece.

Deolanda desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. mas productos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles con los que piensa lograr su objetivo. Ella es una mujer bastante entregada a su familia y que tiene muchas ganas D. salir adelante.
texts.en:
Deolanda is a 63 year old mother who lives with her family in the Boca Chica settlement in the agricultural district of Olmos. This zone is located in the province of Lambayeque, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past five years she has been selling basic necessities and groceries from a market located in her home. There she offers her clients diverse high-quality products for daily use and excellent attention. Because she has been working at this for so long, she currently counts on a established clientele that always come to her business to buy the products she sells. 

Deolanda would like to expand her business by buying more products to offer to her clientele. That is why she has asked for a loan from Edpyme Alternative, with which she hopes to achieve her goal. She is very dedicated to her family and has a strong desire to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy basic products and groceries in order to expand the market she runs from her home.

loans.name: Les Phares Group

texts.en:
Michel is the coordinator of his group Les Phares, which translates from French to "The Lighthouses". He makes his home here in a simple structure with his wife and seven children, ranging in age from 2 to17 yrs. old. He says that his most difficult challenges are in the transportation of his merchandise to the various towns and communities where he sells. The roads are bad, and because the markets are outside, the rain can really disrupt the sales.

Michel is excited to be taking his 1st loan with Esperanza after having heard about the success of others and the growth of their businesses. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business of footwear sales both in nearby Dajabon, Dominican Republic, and other communities in Northern Haiti. He will use the profits to continue to grow his business and help pay for the education and benefit of his family. In the meantime he plans to continue enjoying the work that he does in his church and community.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian clients generally. His group is located in Ounaminthe, which is the town on the border of Haiti and the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of Haiti, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: Boxes of both new and used shoes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 29-year-old lady with a one-year-old child.  For a living, she operates a grocery shop.  She was previously selling handbags.  She has engaged in this business for three years and she hopes to employ people in the future.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become more focused in her business.  She sees herself opening other outlets for her business.  Through Faulu Kenya, she is able to save her money and access financial resources easily.  She has requested 40,000 KES to buy onions, cabbages, kale and cauliflower to sell.

loans.use: To buy onions, cabbages, kale and cauliflower.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married lady who is blessed with one child, age 30.  She is a hardworking lady who does dressmaking and knits sweaters. Her business is located in a very busy environment.  She has been running her business for fourteen years and has employed two people.  She appreciates Faulu Kenya because she has managed to save her money and stabilize her business.  She has requested 30,000 KES to buy fabric, zippers, canvas and buttons.

loans.use: To buy fabric, zippers, canvas and buttons

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is 46 years old.  She sells second-hand clothes in a very busy open air market.  She has been engaged in the business for twenty-one years.  She hopes to expand her shop into wholesale in the future.  Through Faulu Kenya, she is able to save her money.  She has requested 30,000 KES to buy more trousers to sell.

loans.use: To buy trousers to resell

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr: Jean M.  a un salon de coiffure. Il à 23 ans, il est marié, et elle a 3 enfants entre 3 ans et 6 ans. Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 machines à coiffer, 2 miroirs, 1 téléviseur et magnétoscope, 1 amplificateur, 5 tissus et les frais d’installation du lavabo.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est augmenter  les clients de son salon ainsi son chiffre d’affaires augmente avec le bon matériel  pour l’attraction des clients.  Il voudrait acheter une maison d’habitation car il loue, et aussi scolariser ses enfants.  Jean est celui qui est debout dans son salon de coiffure.
texts.en: Jean M. owns a beauty salon. He is 23 years old, married and the father of three children, aged 3 to 6. He wants to use his loan to buy 2 electric clippers, 2 mirrors, 1 TV set with video recorder, 1 amplifier and 5 cutting gowns, as well as pay to have a sink installed. His strategy for increased business consists in investing in high-quality tools to attract more customers. Jean would like to buy a house, because currently he has to rent his dwelling, and to send his children to school. Jean is pictured standing in his salon.

loans.use: To buy chairs, electric clippers, cutting gowns, a TV set, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Zosima

texts.en: Ma. Zosima C. is a married woman who lives in Zone 5, Barangay Tagda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures, a general store and a fish vending business. Her husband Renaldo C., who is 55 years old, works as a tailor to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between 20 and 30 years old. Ma. Zosima joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of approximately $188, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 14th cycle loan, she is borrowing 17,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy more stock that she can sell to customers so that she can continue to save up for future improvements in her business. Ma. Zosima C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell to customers

loans.name: Alma's Group

texts.en:
Alma D. J. is from Barangay Poblacion, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 51 years old. Alma is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Alma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $94 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. 

Alma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Adela

texts.en: Adela E. is a married woman who lives in Purok Narra, Barangay Tinampaan, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a tailoring business and a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband Jose, who is 58 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are 13 to 28 years old. Adela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Adela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $94, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 10th cycle loan, she is borrowing 17,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase raw materials so that she can continue to save up for the future and to put up her own tailoring shop. Adela E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. texts.en: Federita A. is a married woman who lives in Purok 1, Cayhagan, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures. She provides transportation, buys and sells rice, and is also a pump boat operator for fishing. Her husband Sergio A., who is 47 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 17 to 28 years old, with two of them already working and the youngest child currently going to school. Federita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Federita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 27,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $233, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 20th cycle loan, she is borrowing 30,000 PHP, which she intends to use to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for her future, her business and her family's needs. Federita A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah C. is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing business. She lives in Lower Purok 1, Malabugas, Baywan City, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of about $345. Leah is now borrowing 25,000 PHP so that she can purchase new equipment. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 25,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Leah aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. Her husband Raymund, who is 49 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 4 children who are 2 to 21 years old. 

Ruby joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 9 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ruby has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. This time, for her 10th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 28,000 which she intends to use as funds for her business operations so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children.  Ruby L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. In the photo you will see Ruby together with her sons and a carabao that is ready to be sold.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda M. is from the village of Rizaluna Cordon. She is 51 years old. Rosalinda is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a business venture in agriculture sector, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting different kinds of vegetables for sale in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosalinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase seedlings and farm inputs. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Rosalinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia G. is a 51-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: retail selling of charcoal and bananas, operating a sari-sari (general) store and a carinderia (small eatery). She lives in Purok I, Brgy Poblacion II, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard with her retail of charcoal and banana, sari-sari (general) store and carinderia (small eatery) businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP6,000. Delia is now borrowing PHP 22,000 so that she could purchase more stock to sell.  This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP22,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Delia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca B., from the village of Rizaluna Cordon, is 58 years old, married and has six grown children. To make a living, Francisca owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over four years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Francisca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 8000 PHP to be used for the same purpose. Francisca plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Rise And Shine Group - Kayunga

texts.en:
Edith N. is a 57-year-old stickler of diligence who is affiliated with the Rise and Shine group - Kayunga. She has been operating a retail shop for the past decade in Kayunga Town. This growing retail business brings in 120,000 shillings for her on a weekly basis. Edith says to take root in this business, she took a page from a close friend. 

Edith also operates a farming business. As a matter of fact, the farming business was her first business and it's savings from that business that enabled her to start up the retail shop. Edith is happily married with three kids and says this loan is going to help her buy more general merchandise stock for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more retail merchandise for resale at her shop

loans.name: Byona Biyinzika S&c Co-Operation Society - Kampala Group

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Frank M. says with hindsight that hard work and self-motivation have, for the last eight years, served him right in his spare parts business. He is quick to pay compliments to close friends, whom he says prevailed upon him to start this business. Prior to that, he was more inclined to farming. He still does farming but at a low-key level. 

Kiseka market in Kampala is where he operates and 500,000 shillings is what he totals as weekly profits. Frank is happily married with four kids and he says with this loan, he is going to purchase more spare parts for resale. He belongs to the Byona Biyinzika Group - Kampala.

loans.use: The procurement of more spare parts for resale

loans.name: Kagabi Multi-Purpose-Mpigi Group

texts.en:
