María is a member of the “San Salvador” community bank which is located in Capachica district, in Puno province, in Puno department.  She is 74 years old, married, and has six children.  She is illiterate.

María's business activity is selling cheese, quinoa and eggs in the different local markets and in Arequipa.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for ten years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles which allowed her to set up her business.

She is now requesting a new loan for 1,200 nuevos soles which will allow her to increase her business capital.

Her dream is to continue with her business.

What she most likes about her community bank are the activities which take place in the meetings.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with a grown daughter. She is a market entrepreneur from Pavlograd who runs a small clothing sales business in the central marketplace of her home town. She sells women’s outer clothing, such as jackets and fur coats. She owns two vending facilities: a big pavilion and a kiosk at the market. Presently, she has 80,000 UAH in working capital. 

Irina is seeking a loan of 7,500 UAH to increase the assortment of merchandise she offers for sale in her vending locations. The approaching winter season means increased buyer activity, so she wants to stock her supply of clothing items to be able to meet customer demand. She is planning to invest the income generated from the loan back into her business, and to continue growing her trade in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Maxim

texts.en:
Maxim is married. He is a businessman from Pavlograd where he sells fittings and accessories for water and sewer lines. He owns a big pavilion offering a nice selection of items for sale. The pavilion is located in the central marketplace attracting potential customers passing by. Presently, Maxim has 25,000 UAH in inventory.   

Maxim is seeking a loan of 11,000 UAH to purchase additional merchandise and to restock available inventory. Maxim recognizes a good opportunity to broaden the selection of goods he offers and increase his sales volume. As he meets the demand, he will be able to generate the necessary funds to adequately provide for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is an entrepreneur from Pavlograd. She runs a small business selling bedding, linens and sheets in the central market of her home town. She has been in the trade for a while. Currently, she has about 50,000 UAH in turnover capital.   

Irina is seeking a loan of 6,000 UAH to diversify the merchandise she offers for sale in her kiosk. She is a determined and focused hard-worker. She works long hours and knows the value of money. She has a grown son who has his own small startup business. She is actively helping him learn some of the tricks of the trade and provides much needed financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 31-year-old innovative father of three living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to increase his daily income and savings for his family and to educate his children so they attain better qualifications. He sells secondhand shoes and has been in the business for four years. The business is profitable; however, his goal is to have a wholesale shop. Moses intends to use the loan funds to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a 32-year-old enterprising woman, married to a driver, with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She lives in a semi permanent house and is vested with the responsibility of taking care of six household members with the help of her husband. Her dream is to be able to pay school fees for her children through to tertiary institutions. She has been selling secondhand shoes and clothes for twelve years, and she has been able to rise from hawking her goods to owning a shop. She is challenged with the high cost of rent and seasonal sales. Her business dream is to operate from her own premises. This being the Christmas season, when demand for her products is high, Christine has decided to inject extra capital into the business; thus, the need for a loan to buy clothes and shoes to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes to sell in her shop

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida belongs to Lahore, which is the second largest city of Pakistan and is known for its culture and fashion. She lives there in the area named Yadgar with her family in a two-room brick house. 

She is a very supportive lady and supports her family financially by making artificial flowers. She receives orders from different gift shops and flower shops of the market and provides them finished goods on time to earn an income. These artificial flowers are used for the decoration of homes and particularly in weddings. 

Her husband, M. A., is a private entrepreneur and sells animal food as a business. He has a shop in the market and sells from there a good quantity of food every day and earns a good income. 

Zahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband for his business. With the loan, he will buy more animal food to sell through his shop and improve his business.
 
Zahida is hopeful that with the help of a loan investment, her husband will be able to get maximum results from his business.

loans.use: To buy animal food for an animal-food business

loans.name: Fehmida's Group

texts.en:
Fehmida lives in the second largest city of Pakistan called Lahore.  It is an historic city and known for its culture and food.  She lives in the area named Yadgar with her family in a 2 room brick house.  She moved here after her marriage many years ago. 

She is a seamstress and sews clothes for her clients who live in nearby areas.  She also operates a clothes sales business.  She purchases clothes from Lahore’s wholesale markets named “Ichra and Shahalmi” and sells them to her local area clients.  Because both of her businesses are related to clothing, that is why this business combination is working well for her.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes sales business.  With the loan, she will buy clothes of different variety in bulk quantity for sale.  The bulk purchasing will help her to cut her cost of purchasing and to improve her sales.  She is hopeful that by utilizing a loan in her business she will be able to get the desired results.

loans.use: To buy clothes of different variety in bulk quantity for her clothes sale business.

loans.name: Rubi's Group

texts.en:
Rubi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially assist her husband who runs a small restaurant in the local market.  He offers different kind of Punjabi foods and also tea to his customers.  He has a good number of clients due to his food’s good quality and reasonable rates. 

With the loan amount, he will buy required items such as cooking oil, lentils, rice, spices etc.  This will help him improve his business and maintain better quality food for his customers.  

Rubi is very supportive in nature.  She never misses a chance to help her husband and family to improve their standard of living.  She makes beautiful artificial flowers to financially support her family.  She takes orders from different gifts shops and flowering shops and provide them finished goods to earn an income for her family. 

She lives in Lahore which is the 2nd largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture.  It attracts thousands of visitors from all over the world every month.  Rubi is hopeful that with the help of a loan, her husband’s business will become better and she will be able to provide a better future to her children.

loans.use: To buy required items for restaurant business.

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is a very talented woman, operating her clothing sales business to share the financial burden with her husband. She purchases clothes from the Ichra and Shahalmi wholesale markets in Lahore and sells to her local area clients.

Shakeela lives in Lahore, Pakistan's second largest city, famous for its food and culture. She lives with her family in a 2-room brick house in the area of Yadgar. Life is not easy in a big city as the cost of living is getting higher and higher every day, which leads to continuous efforts to improve business conditions to meet the needs of daily life. Therefore, Shakeela has applied for a loan from KIVA's partner Asasah to improve her clothing sales business. She plans to use the loan to buy a variety of clothes in bulk. This will help her offer more variety to her clients and to make more sales. She is hopeful that an investment will improve her business conditions and bring good changes to her family’s financial life.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a 32-year-old married woman living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of taking care of the family and her family dream is educating her child up to a tertiary instituition. She sells second hand shoes and has been in business for one year. Her business dream is to diversify into the transportation sector. Betty needs the credit facility to buy a motorcycle for business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for business

loans.name: Possiano

texts.en: Possiano is a 22-year-old married man with a child living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda and his dream is having a stable income to sustain the family. He is into motorcycle transport and has been in the sector for two years now. His major challenge is not owning the motorcycle and this limits his income level. His business desire is to own a motorcycle to avoid remitting the daily income to the boss. Possiano needs the loan to buy a motorcycle for business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for business

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is a 32-year-old single mother living in her own permanent house with her child in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her family dream is building rental houses to support her child in school. She owns a textile shop and has been in this business for nine years. This has enabled her to construct a permanent house. However, she longs to become a wholesale trader someday. Edith intends to buy more clothes to as the Christmas season is fast approaching

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 30-year-old man married to a farmer with four children living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a retail shop and has been in the business for one year. He is faced with the challenge of failing to meet the high demands of his customers due to limited capital. David needs the credit facility to purchase merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To purchase general merchadise

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 32-year-old married man with two children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to acquire a number of assets that can generate money for the family sustainably. He owns a retail shop and a secretarial centre and for five years in such businesses, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and pay his workers. Nevertheless, he wants to have secretarial services in at least 10 urban centers. Emmanuel needs the loan to buy merchandise to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell

loans.name: Hilda María

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 39 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el distrito de Pacasmayo, una zona comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia del mismo nombre, en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en un ambiente del domicilio donde reside, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes productos de consumo diario brindándoles un buen trato, por este motivo en el corto tiempo que tiene en el negocio (un año) se ha hecho conocida y cuenta con una clientela fiel.

Ella desea adquirir más productos para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
 
Hilda es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Ella se esfuerza a diario en su negocio y las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Hilda is 39 years old.  She is single and lives together with her parents in Pacasmayo district which is a commercial district located in the province of Pacasmayo, in La Libertad region, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Hilda sells convenience store items and groceries in a small grocery store located in her home.  There she offers her customers products for daily consumption, providing them with good service.  For this reason, in the short time which she has had her business (one year) she has become well known and has a loyal customer base.

She would like to acquire more products to satisfy her customers' demands and increase her sales.  For this reason, she has decided to request a loan for 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her achieve her goal.

Hilda is a woman who has a great desire to get ahead in life.  She works hard every day in her business and the people who know her consider her to be responsible and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy convenience store items and groceries to expand her grocery store

loans.name: Italia

texts.es:
Italia tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Pacasmayo, una zona comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia del mismo nombre, en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. El negocio ya cuenta con una antigüedad de tres años y gracias a el puede ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante la economía de su familia. Su clientela se encuentra fidelizada debido a que siempre les ofrece productos de buena calidad y un trato amable.

Italia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda aumentar su nivel de ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles. 

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que siempre vela por el bienestar de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para sacarlos adelante.
texts.en:
Italia is 55 years old.  She is married and lives with her family in Pacasmayo district, a commercial district which is located in the province of Pacasmayo, in La Libertad region, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo which is the capital of Lambayeque region.

Italia sells convenience store products and groceries in a small grocery store which is located in her home.  Her business is three years old and, thanks to her business, she has been able to help her husband to improve their family finances.  She has loyal customers owing to the fact that she always offers them good quality products and kind service.

Italia would like to expand her business, buying more products so that she can increase her sales and make more profits.  In order to achieve her goal she has approached Edpyme Alternativa to request a loan for 2,000 nuevos soles.

Italia is quite a hard-working woman who is always looking out for her family's well-being.  Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and to get her family ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy convenience store items and groceries to expand her grocery store

loans.name: Jorge Camilo

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 39 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos. Vive junto a su familia en una casa alquilada, la cual está ubicada en el distrito de Santa Cruz, un distrito ubicado en la sierra norte del país y que pertenece a la región Cajamarca. Se encuentra situado a más de tres horas de viaje de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar junto a su esposa en la venta de golosinas, emoliente y comida, esta actividad la desarrollan desde hace 4 años, por lo que cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Ellos realizan esta actividad de manera ambulante valiéndose para ello de un triciclo.

Jorge se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles, el destino del crédito será para implementar otro triciclo, con el cual piensan ampliar su negocio ya que están cerca las fiestas navideñas y durante estas fechas la demanda suele incrementarse. Con esta inversión el espera obtener mayores ingresos y poder mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 39 years old, married, and has 2 children. He lives with his family in a rented house in the district of Santa Cruz, which is located in the northern mountains of the country and which belongs to the region of Cajamarca. Santa Cruz is located more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. 

He works with his wife to sell sweets, emoliente [an herbal beverage], and food. They have had this business for 4 years, so they have an established base of customers in the neighborhood. They work as street vendors and use a tricycle cart to carry everything.

Jorge is requesting a loan of PEN 1,000.00 from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will buy another tricycle cart, which they plan to use to expand their business, since the holiday season is coming up and demand usually increases. With this investment he hopes to increase his income and improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy a tricycle cart to expand his sweets-selling business.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera y reside junto a su menor hijo en el distrito agrícola de Pomalca, una zona situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de cinco años a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en so domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario brindándoles un buen trato, su negocio cuenta con clientela fidelizada y gracias a el puede sacar adelante la economía de su hogar.

Luz desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería de modo que pueda responder de mejor manera a su demanda y pueda obtener mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Luz is 39 years old.  She is a single mother and lives together with her young son in the agricultural district of Pomalca, an area which is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Luz has been selling convenience store items and groceries in a small grocery store located in her home for more than five years.  There she offers her customers a variety of products for daily use with good service.  Her business has a loyal customer base and, thanks to this fact, she has been able to improve her household's financial situation.

Luz would like to expand her business, acquiring more merchandise so that she can better respond to her customers' demand and obtain better profits.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to expand her grocery store

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano es un padre de familia de 56 años que reside junto a su esposa y aun hijo en el sector La Clake, una zona rural del distrito de Reque, ubicado a más de quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de cerdos, el cría cerdos cerca a su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona a menudo, eventualmente los vende sacrificados a sus vecinos. Esta es su fuente mas importante de ingresos por lo que siempre trata de sacarla delante.

Luciano desea adquirir más cerdos y alimento balaceado para percibir mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Luciano is a 56-year-old father who lives with his wife and one child in the La Clake area, a rural zone of the district of Reque, located more than 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

His work is raising and selling pigs. He raises pigs near his home, and when they have reached a good stage of development, he offers them for sale to the commercial buyers who visit the area on a regular basis. Sometimes he butchers them and sells them to his neighbors. This is his most important source of income, and for this reason he is always trying to improve his business. 

Luciano would like to acquire more pigs and balanced animal feed so that he can earn a better income and improve his quality of life. For this reason, he has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 Peruvian new soles, which will help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: Buying pigs and animal feed to expand his business

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el sector Punto Nueve, una zona rural que tiene como principal actividad económica a la agricultura, se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Mochumí, a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, ella cría pavos, pollos y cerdos en la parte posterior de su domicilio alimentándoles de granos pastos naturales, quincenalmente los comercializa en el mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Con este negocio ella apoya a su esposo, que es albañil, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Santos desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más animales y alimento balanceado de ese modo planea mejorar su nivel de ventas y su calidad de vida. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Santos is a mother, is 49 years old, and lives with her husband and their three children in the town of Punto Nueve, a rural area where the main economic activity is agriculture. It is located in the district of Mochumí, more than half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises and sells small animals, such as turkeys, chickens, and pigs in the back yard of her house. She feeds them natural grain and grasses. Every two weeks, she sells them in the Moshoqueque market in the city of Chiclayo. Through this business she helps her husband, who is a mason, to provide for their family.

Santos would like to expand her business by obtaining more animals and feed. In this way, she plans to improve her sales and quality of life. In order to achieve her goal, she is requesting a loan of PEN 1,500.00 from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy more animals and feed to expand her business of raising and selling small animals.

loans.name: América

texts.es:
América es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el sector Santa Clara del distrito de Pítipo, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de ganado vacuno. Ella adquiere vacas a sus vecinos y las engorda para luego revenderlas a los negociantes que siempre vienen a visitarla, el negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia por lo que siempre trata de mantenerlo de la mejor manera.

América desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más ganado, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar, las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer bastante responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
America is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Santa Clara in the district of Pítipo. It is an agricultural area in the province of Ferreñafe, over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

America works selling cattle. She buys cows from her neighbors and works to fatten them to sell to traders who come to visit her. Her business is an important source of income for her family, and for this reason she tries to run it as best she can.  

America would like to expand her business by purchasing more cattle. She has asked Edpyme Alternativa [the Kiva field partner] for a loan of 1000 Peruvian Soles to help her achieve this goal. She is a woman with a great desire to do better and get ahead in life, and those who know her consider her responsible and hardworking.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle for fattening and eventual sale

loans.name: Sinthia Paola

texts.es:
Sinthia tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. El negocio ya cuenta con una antigüedad de un año y gracias a el puede solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres a sostener la economía de su familia. Su clientela se encuentra fidelizada debido a que siempre les ofrece productos de buena calidad y un trato amable.

Sinthia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda aumentar su nivel de ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. 

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que siempre vela por el bienestar de su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para ayudarlos a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sinthia is 22 years old, is single, and lives with her parents in the Olmos district, an agricultural area in the Lambayeque province located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells staple items and groceries in a store located in her house.  The business is already a year old, and thanks to it she can pay for her personal expenses and help her parents with the family finances.  Her customers are loyal because she always offers them quality products and friendly service.

Sinthia wants to expand her business by purchasing more products so she can increase her sales and earn more.  To achieve her goal she decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles.

She is a very hardworking woman and is always looking out for the well-being of her family.  Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman in order to help her family move forward.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to expand her grocery store
